BitVoyant produces business and network intelligence, enabling companies to intimately understand their interactions and risks in real-time and at Internet scale. WeÃ¢Â€Â™re growing our team to create, enrich, and mine this intelligence for insights that matter to our customers.

As a Data Scientist (Big Data), you will apply cutting-edge statistical and mathematical methods to the collection, correlation and analysis of large structured and unstructured data sets from a broad, ever-evolving set of sources. The successful applicant will apply industry knowledge, contextual understanding, and innovative insights into the development of novel analytical techniques and tools in response to urgent, complex questions. The ideal candidate will:

Responsibilities
Provide valuable insights into new data sets quickly
Mine large amounts of data for insights with both automated and ad-hoc queries
Communicate complex findings and ideas in plain language that is friendly to business and operational audiences
Problem solve Ã¢Â€Â“ turn requirements into solutions
Collaborate with team members with varying technical and non-technical backgrounds towards a shared goal
Rapidly research and iterate on analysis methods by finding elegant, reliable and understandable techniques to build analytics that matter
Create technical assessments and develop custom approaches in response to time-critical urgent customer needs
Employ sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning, and statistical methods to prepare data for use in predictive and prescriptive modeling
Examine new and more convincing methods for data reporting, visualization & presentation
Develop new approaches to apply large-scale computing technology to solve customer problems
Be involved in all stages of analytic development from idea formation through prototyping, automation, and productizing
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of technology standards, industry trends, emerging techniques, and analytic best practices
Keep informed of evolution and impact of adversary tactics and strategies
Ensure analytical issues are quickly resolved and help implement strategies and solutions to reduce the likelihood of reoccurrence

Requirements - Our ideal candidate will meet most but not necessarily all of the following requirements:

US Citizenship or authorization to work in the US

Possess TS/SCI security clearance

BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree or higher in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent

Possess solid understanding of Cyber Security terminology, concepts and technology

Possess solid understanding of Internet communication protocol

Must have at least 1 to 2 years demonstrated experience with
Hadoop, Elasticsearch
NoSQL, HDFS
Python
JSON data formats, Parquet files
Structured and Unstructured data
Supervised and Unsupervised Machine Learning techniques

Desired skills
Big Data Platforms and tools (e.g. Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR, Hadoop, Pig, Hive, etc.)
Impala, and SQL Ã¢Â€Â“ for queries
NoSQL databases (ex. HBase, MongoDB,ArangoDB, Neo4J) Ã¢Â€Â“ for behavioral analysis
C/C++/C#, Scala, PySpark, Java, R, R Shiny, or other comparable programming language
Data formats Ã¢Â€Â“ ex. JSON, flat files, Parquet, ORC files, Avro
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes
Statistical data analysis packages (SPSS, R, etc.)
Data visualization tools (ex. Tableau, Qlik, IPython, etc.)
Comfortable with rapid prototyping to solve immediate problems
Super user level expertise in Linux / Unix, Mac, and Windows operating systems.
Additional Machine Learning techniques, ex. Auto Encoders, Deep Learning, Hierarchical Clustering, Outlier and Anomaly Detection, etc.

Ability to process, filter, and establish the utility of data through various analytics techniques

Demonstrated creativity, foresight, and mature judgment in answering complex and difficult analytical questions

Strong written and verbal communication skills
column3:
First San Francisco partners offers specialized services and IT Consulting, focused on helping organizations understand and benefitfrom Enterprise Information Management and emerging big data strategies. Our services span data governance, data quality strategies, data management architecture, master data management strategy and implementation, analytics and big data.
Job Responsibilities and Duties
We have an immediate opening for a Data Analyst who will manage and drive the development of business and data requirements and functional specifications for BI, MDM and data quality projects throughout the development life cycle from planning, initial analysis and design all the way through to implementation and user acceptance. The emphasis for this position is data quality.
Capable of Data Profiling of source data to provide understanding of the source data to assist business users in refining information requirements.
Able to relate source data to business information so that the implications of source data structures can be explained to business users in business terms.
Capable of analyzing data to detect possible data quality exceptions, and ability to communicate these issues to business users effectively.
Ability to work with business users in Data Issue Management around detected Data Quality problems; especially assisting the drive towards root cause solutions.
Able to assist with conceptual, logical, and physical data modeling, and interface effectively with data modelers.
Able to capture metrics about data environments, such as frequency of different types of data quality issues, and to report effectively on these to business and IT stakeholders.
Able to assist with development of technical requirements for data integration and changed data capture for MDM and BI environments.
Is able to specify data extraction from sources.
Can assist with capturing information requirements.
Is able to conduct manual Data Quality analysis when no formal DQ tool is included in project.
Can identify root causes of data quality issues.
Able to help update Metadata Repository.
Able to map and update mapping templates.
Able to prepare estimates for projects assigned.
Able to manage any change requests related to the working project plans daily to meet the agreed deadlines.
Operates as a strategic partner with IT to influence the design, alignment, and implementation of technical standards to address appropriate business solutions.
Skills and Qualifications:5 years of experience working in a data analyst or closely related data-centric role.
Very proficient in SQL, and variants (e.g. in different platforms).
Understanding of relational database concepts, such as referential integrity.
Ability to work with stored procedures.
Good understanding of, and ability to utilize, technical metadata present in database platforms.
Ability to read, understand and contribute to data models.
Understanding of common data services, especially ETL, backup, restore, role-based security.
Familiarity with types of data quality issues, and approaches to their resolution.
Experience with common data analyst support tools (e.g. TOAD, SQL Navigator).
Experience with data mapping (Source to Target mapping).
Excellent communication skills, presentation and interpersonal skills are required.
A demonstrated track record of making a difference and adding value.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to multi-task.
Ability to think creatively, is highly-driven and self-motivated.
Ability to work and adjust to changing deadlines.
Can demonstrate creative problem-solving skills.
Must be able to develop relationships across the organization, working cross- functionally to get results.
Ability to present complex information in a simplified fashion to facilitate understanding.
Can effectively manipulate and analyze large amounts of data.
Proficient with MS Office products.
Bachelor's degree in Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, CIS or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Experience with Data Profiling tools and Data Quality tools is a definite plus, although purely manual techniques may be used in any given assignment.
Familiarity with Metadata Repository tools is also a definite plus.
Requirements:
Must be able to travel at least 50% to client site.
Can work remotely

DataScience Inc. is the provider of the DataScience Cloud, a data science platform that brings together best-in-class tools, infrastructure, and expertise in a modern, full-service offering. With the DataScience Cloud, data scientists can connect and explore varied data sources, build models and algorithms, and seamlessly deploy work throughout their entire organization. The DataScience Cloud allows any data science team- regardless of their tech stack or level of engineering support- to deliver value at scale.

DataScience.com is ranked #1 among the Ã¢Â€ÂœTop 100 Best Places to Work in LAÃ¢Â€Â ( http://www.bestplacestoworkla.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=67 ) for 2015.
Los Angeles Business Journal

At DataScience we also help our preferred partners hire the top data scientists all over the world. If you meet the requirements below, apply here and work with the DataScience Cloud ( https://www.datascience.com/products ) at one of our preferred partners, which include a number of world-class organizations.
Role summary:
DataScience is seeking a data-driven individual with a passion for applying statistics, machine learning, and analysis to data sets to unlock insights. At DataScience, we bring together the brightest data engineers and data scientists to help our customers extract the information they need from their data. This individual will be responsible for directing and leading the delivery of academic-grade analyses to answer our customersÃ¢Â€Â™ questions and extract insights from their data.
Job requirements:Interface with internal and external stakeholders to gather clear analytic requirements
Perform hypothesis-driven analysis and communicate results to senior management
Conduct deep and continuous exploration of high-volume heterogenous data
Develop clear visualizations to convey complex ideas in straightforward ways
Build and automate various models such as time series forecasting, regression analysis, classifiers, etc. using cutting edge modeling and machine learning techniques
Required experience:Entry-level experience using applied data science on business problems
Deep understanding of advertising analytics and developing A/B testing experiments
Top-notch analysis skills and the ability to explore complex data sets and extract insights
Expert-level skills with SQL required
A passion for Python or R and the Jupyter environment
Experience with pandas, numpy, sk-learn
A minimum of a BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree (Advanced degree preferred) in statistics, engineering, computer science, or any other quantitative field
What we offer:Full benefits that start on day one
Open vacation policy
Catered lunches and randomly spawning breakfast burritos, donuts, and cookies.
Stocked kitchens with awesome munchies and coffee bars
A commitment to ensuring you have the essential tools you need to succeed.
A culture that emanates education with weekly in office meet-ups, readings, and presentations
A meaningful educational allowance to promote your growth
Company sponsored outings, happy hours, and events
New creative office space that is modern and spacious
Ground floor opportunity to contribute to the changing of the data science landscape

Do you want to work at the intersection of neuroscience, business, and technology? Do you want to bring the power and complexity of predictive analytics to the workplace?
Our team applies machine learning techniques to behavioral data to predict what industry, company, or position you might best be suited for. We are using these techniques to disrupt current labor markets and make the process of finding your dream job or career more efficient. We attract those who gravitate towards difficult problems. Requirements

Experience with a scripting language (Python and its scientific libraries SciPy, Scikit, Pandas, and NumPy preferred)
Experience working with data sets; processing, analyzing, and communicating results.

Experience in Linux/Unix environment and shell scripting
Experience with full-stack development in back-end environment with Python and relational databases preferred
Experience conducting methods using any of the following: machine learning, predictive modeling, statistical inference, experimental design, data mining, and optimization

Creativity: you can conceive of new data driven products, features, and technologies
Results: you prioritize, focusing on ideas and features that will have significant, measurable impact
Planning: ability to set and meet your own project objectives & milestones
Ability to coordinate effectively with team members in engineering, design, and product management
Communicate results and progress internally and externally in meetings, presentations, and tech talks
MA, MS, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, etc.); research experience or relevant graduate studies a plus.
Interested in finding out if youÃ¢Â€Â™re a top fit?
Send your resume to evan@pymetrics.com

Position Title: Analytics Data Engineer
Location: Bellevue, WA.

Our Story

Merkle is a global data-driven, technology-enabled performance marketing agency and the largest independent agency in the US for CRM, digital, and search. For more than 28 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with us to build and maximize the value of their customer portfolios. We work with brands like Dell, T-Mobile, Samsung, Geico, Regions, Kimberly-Clark, AARP, Lilly, Sanofi, NBC Universal, DIRECTV, American Cancer Society, Susan G. Komen, and many others to build and execute customer centric business strategies.

Role Purpose

WeÃ¢Â€Â™re looking for an Analytics Data Engineer with experience designing, implementing and maintaining ETL lifecycles using Cloud based data architectures (Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google). You will have to extract data from a wide variety of source systems, merge them in an Analytics or BI mart and conform the data sets to support advanced reporting and analysis platforms. You must also embrace working within the Ã¢Â€Â˜creative constraintsÃ¢Â€Â™ presented by the data infrastructures of our clients, which vary far and wide across both brand and architecture. Big data experience is a plus. Big data experience is a requirement.

This isnÃ¢Â€Â™t a position that has you just sitting behind a desk. You will be required to work closely with clients and internal teams during requirements gathering, in tandem with our technology and analytics teams on architecture and scripting, and work closely enough with our analysts to understand how the data sets you create will be used. This is a growth area for our business, so there is also as much leadership potential available with this role as you are interested in and capable of.

Key Responsibilities
Data Management:
Implement the appropriate ETL processes using relevant languages, frameworks, and agile methodology to support the BI/Analytic projects.Critical Skills include: C#, SQL, Scope, Python.Map Reduce and Javascript desired.

Build out appropriate data structures or reshape data to support MerkleÃ¢Â€Â™s BI and Analytics Technology stack using etl tools where appropriate.Tools like: SSIS, SSAS, Talend, Alteyrx, etc.

Enable analysts accessing the data through Tableau, Excel, PowerPivot, Power BI, , and other reporting tools

Support and/or automate data refresh jobs to support frequent updates
Client Service & Portfolio Enablement:
Demonstrate commitment to MerkleÃ¢Â€Â™s philosophy of client service

Manage client questions and requests, solving technical problems and providing guidance involving technical and business knowledge

Lead requirements gathering meetings to translate analysis and reporting requirements into data requirements

Work closely with engagement leadership to develop and grow engagements

Facilitate dialogue between client and 3rd party vendor contacts where appropriate
Practice support & Development:
Drive thought leadership on how we deliver world-class analytic marketing data solutions and enablement leveraging cloud based solutions.

Author process documentation and contribute to internal knowledge base

Cross-train colleagues on cloud data engineering best practices

Explore and evaluate new tools as they relate to analytic data management and media integration.

Key Skills and Experience

3-6 years of relevant work experience

Attention to detail, results oriented, customer focus, strong team player, personal leadership

Ability to deal with ambiguity, strong analytics and problem solving skills, exercise sound business judgment

Passion for process improvement

Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to translate data into meaningful information in a concise and effective manner
Special considerations for:
Expert level knowledge of the Microsoft Azure, Cosmos, and Business Intelligence stack

Advanced SQL, Scope, C#, Python, Javascript, and map reduce

Experience with Agile Project Development and Continuous integration and delivery supporting Analysts and data Scientists on analytic projects

Experience with Cloud based technologies such as Amazon Redshift, Amazon EMR, SparkR, Google BigQuery, Azure Data Lake,Ã¢Â€Â¦and various data storage solutions is desired.

Experience optimizing data structures for cloud based deployments and use by Business Intelligence and analytic tools such as Tableau, SAS, R, PowerBI

Experience building solutions using Object Oriented Programming and Test Driven Development

Experience working with Adobe (Omniture) Digital Marketing Suite (SiteCatalyst)

Experience working with MicroSoft WEDCS tagging data

Experience with web analytics or web data

Experience with cross channel media marketing & analytics
Knowledge of file storage systems: Hadoop, MongoDB, Redshift, or others.

Experience with GIT

This job description is a summary of the essential functions of the job, not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of all possible job responsibilities, tasks, and duties. The responsibilities, tasks, and duties of the jobholder might differ from those outlined in the job description. Other duties, as assigned by the supervisor, might be part of the job

Job Number: R0000370

Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise.

Big Data Developer
Key Role:

Ingest data from various structured and unstructured data sources into Hadoop and other distributed Big Data systems. Support the sustainment and delivery of an automated ETL pipeline using a suite of COTS, GOTS, Java, and other tools. Validate data that is extracted from structured and unstructured data inputs, databases, and other repositories using scripts and other automated capabilities, logs, and queries. Enrich and transform extracted data, as required. Monitor and report the data flow through the ETL process. Perform data extractions, data purges, or data fixes in accordance with current internal procedures and policies. Track development and operational support via user stories and decomposed technical tasks in a provided issue tracking software, including GIT, Maven, and JIRA.

-5+ years of experience with software development throughout the SDLC

-5+ years of experience with Java development

-Experience with Accumulo

-Experience with Linux, including CentOS and Red Hat

-Experience with working on Scrum or other Agile methodology

-Top Secret clearance

-BA or BS degree

Additional Qualifications:

-Experience with ingesting data into Hadoop or Accumulo

-Experience with Apache NiFi

-Experience with an open source software contributor, including GitHub, code.google.com, or apache.com

-BS degree in CS or a related field preferred; MS degree in CS or a related field a plus

Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Top Secret clearance is required.

Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems. by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.

We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet.

Are you passionate about working with data? Are you a hands-on technologist interested in how information can transform business and government? If so, Deloitte could be the place for you! Join our Federal Analytics and Information Management (AIM) team and tackle challenging issues in Advanced Analytics, Big Data Architecture, and Information Delivery. A career at Deloitte will put you on the frontline, supporting Federal agencies tasked with the most critical technical challenges . Work youÃ¢Â€Â™ll do 
As a Consultant in our practice you will:
Problem solve and offer ideas to solve client issues
Conduct relevant research, data analysis, and create reports
Identify efficiencies and innovative approaches
Maintain responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products
Assist in proposal development as requested
Develop your skills through training courses, mentoring, and daily interaction with clients
Work on big data analytics projects for federal clients
Work in small team environments to solve complex problems The team 
Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping Federal government initiatives today. DeloitteÃ¢Â€Â™s Federal practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Carrying out missions in the Federal practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the Federal marketplace. 
The Federal Government is seeing massive increases in the amount of information that it creates, collects, and manages to support data driven decision making, and in some cases exceeding the limits of traditional approaches and technology. Our Federal AIM team helps change the way clients leverage data through innovative and robust solutions within traditional landscapes as well as emerging areas including Big Data, Internet of Things/Everything, cognitive analytics, and machine learning. Qualifications 
Required:
Bachelor's degree and at least 1 year of technology consulting or other relevant industry experience
Proven ability to effectively prioritize workload and meet deadlines
Experience crafting written communications that are clear, succinct and audience appropriate
Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation creation tools, as well as Internet research tools
Must be able to obtain and maintain required clearance for this role
2 or more years of professional experience in analytics tools besides Excel (tableau, SAS, SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Able to work directly with clients to explain how analytics will help solve their problems
Preferred:
Degree in computer science, information systems, or other technology-related field
Prior professional services or federal consulting experience
Professional experience with one or more of the following technologies:
BI tools: SAP Business Objects, Cognos, OBIEE, SAS, Hyperion
DW/ETL Tools: Informatica, ODI, SAP Data Services, SAP BW/HANA, Datastage
EPM: Hyperion Essbase, Cognos Planning
EDM: Data Modeling, Erwin, DBA
MDM Ã¢Â€Â“ Informatica
Data Analytics: Big data, ZoomData, Hadoop, machine learning, text analytics, Tableau How youÃ¢Â€Â™ll grow 
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe thereÃ¢Â€Â™s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. Benefits 
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. DeloitteÃ¢Â€Â™s culture 
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. Corporate citizenship 
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about DeloitteÃ¢Â€Â™s impact on the world. Recruiter tips 
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area youÃ¢Â€Â™re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

Responsibilities
Job Detail:
This position is customer facing with internal and external stakeholders. The employee will with work with the data-analytics team in developing front-end communication plans through systems and newly developed processes. They will also communicate and track Supply Chain Interval and Inventory results, as well as lead time analytics. The expectation is that the employee will implement plans to tie in the Engineering and Supply Planning community. The overall goal is to optimize the inventory cycle time through the use of proactive analytics and tools developed on this Wireline Network Strategy Team.
Responsibilities: Analytics Ã¢Â€Â“ 40% Analyzes COE, PICS, and OSP engineering systems and work with Network Engineering to improve equipment ordering visibility and efficiency Analyzes supply chain intervals from supplier shipped to consumption and seeks opportunities to reduce overall product cycle times Develop and analyze KPI & SLA intervals of Strategic Programs to identify Supplier deficiencies and new program opportunities Drives data validation and ownership of supply and demand planning results planning and utilizes data driven decisions to determine KPI improvements Projects - 35% Will be responsible for managing and supporting development of collaborative platforms and tools that connect stakeholders to the Supply Chain Will drive projects that automate current manual CIP process, such as MSOLV (RED/Green) Light Support cross-functional and cross-area initiatives. Represent SCM with improvements on Inventory controls, forecast accuracy and business processes Develops visualization tools such as Tableau for decision making and trouble shooting and connects results and utilization with all stakeholders Presentations- 25% Prepares executive readouts on CIP reduction initiatives Provide necessary presentations and reporting to Area and HQ teams as needed Train and prepares stakeholders on supply chain collaborative tools, such as BI and Tableau Aggregates project milestones and updates from internal team and prepares final results
Qualifications
Must have: BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in supply chain, engineering, business or equivalent experience preferred. 3 or more years or relevant experience. Experience with Data/Analytics tools (Tableau, Business Intelligence). Ability to Create custom queries to calculate and analyze program and group metrics utilizing inter-department databases Able to create complex SQL queries using complex joins, grouping, aggregation, and nested subqueries Import, export and manipulate large data sets in multi-million-row databases under tight deadlines Understanding of database back-end and ability to affect change as needed for reporting requirements through inter-department forums. Outstanding leadership and organizational skills. Excellent presentation skills in (PPT), plus outstanding communication skills. Excellent problem-solving ability.
Ideally, you have: Experience with supply chain systems NSAP/VSAP Experience with medium and large scale IT projects

Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.

The position reports to a Senior Manager of Compliance. This role will support the implementation of corporate compliance programs with a focus on 1.) aggregate spend management, 2.) auditing and monitoring, 3.) policy, training, and communications, and 4.) physician contracting administration

Responsibilities:

Aggregate Spend

column15:
Aloha~

Tommy Bahama is a lifestyle company that defines relaxed, sophisticated style. From its casual-yet-upscale collections of men's and women's apparel, swimwear, footwear, accessories and home furnishings to island-inspired cuisine and cocktails with a signature twist at our restaurants, your island escape is well within reach. Tommy Bahama is looking for qualified team members to join our efforts to create an island lifestyle that inspires the world to relax.

MISSION

The Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for creating, implementing and performing various analyses across all areas of the business including daily/weekly/monthly reporting on Retail/eComm/Restaurant promotions as well as analysis of sales and profitability trends across product lines, divisions, regions.

As a member of the FP&A team, this position is responsible for working with various end-users across different roles in the organization in gathering requirements and providing data and analyses and interpreting the information and providing actionable results. This position serves as a key financial liaison between Marketing, Finance, IT and Retail/eComm/Restaurant Operations.

KEY RESULTS AREAS
Prepare and distribute accurate daily, weekly and monthly reports on key promotions
Develop analytics on promotion results to guide future decision-making
Mine data from one or more sources, validate and analyze data to ensure accurate reporting
Determine the data elements required for new promotions and create meaningful reports at a summary and detailed transaction level
Work with the marketing team and develop financial models used to quantify incremental sales from marketing promotions or new product launches
Work with the operating groups to ensure transactions are properly rung to capture accurate data for reporting
Prepare financial analysis on business results for inclusion in SEC filings and press releases
Ability to understand and navigate various software packages to generate accurate and timely reports
Assist in development of annual budgets and forecasts
Assist with dashboard and report generation
Assist with selection and implementation of business intelligence reporting tool such as Tableau

EXPERIENCE, TALENT AND EDUCATION
BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field required
4-6 yearsÃ¢Â€Â™ work experience in business and financial analysis
Advanced knowledge of Excel formatting data, including using macros and pivot tables
Ability to understand corporate finance, financial modeling, and analytical tools (DCF, IRR, payback)
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where self-motivation and initiative are critical to success
Experience building and managing financial models for business forecasting and variance analysis
Ability to access data from financial systems and understand the corporate mapping and hierarchy
Aptos/SAP/BPC experience preferred
Comfortable with ad-hoc database queries as well as structured scripts/reports
Solid organization, time management and project estimating skills
Ability to handle ambiguity and work independently
Ability to learn quickly, multi task and adapt to fast paced working environment

Mahalo (thank you) for your interest in Tommy Bahama!

Tommy Bahama participates in E-Verify. Details in English and Spanish . Right to Work Statement in English and Spanish .
column16: You must apply at www.pfizercareers.com and search for Job ID 1047954.Please note, any applications submitted through this website will not be reviewed for consideration.About PfizerA career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact.All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.Role DescriptionAs a member of the Pfizer's Analytics team, a component of Pfizer's Business Technology organization, the Data Scientist will join a group dedicated to leveraging data and advanced analytics to create a healthier world. Specifically, this group is focused on developing a set of capabilities designed to enable highly efficient exploration, experimentation, and ultimately rapid hypothesis generation based on internal, public, and commercially available datasets.Day-to-day, the Data Scientist will actively support ad-hoc analysis efforts by groups across Pfizer largely focused on identifying, developing, and delivering life-changing therapies to patients around the world. Further, this role will be a key contributor to the team's on-going analytic product development activities; an essential component to creating a scalable analytics capability for Pfizer.In addition, as technologists within Pfizer's analytic eco-system; this role will also participate in the assessment of new technologies as well as identifying next-generation solution architectures.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with teams across Pfizer to maximize the use of data in answering key questions related to: acceleration of drug discovery efforts, identification of drug repurposing opportunities, optimization of clinical trial activities, improving patient access to Pfizer therapies through a better understanding of outcomes & patterns of care, and maximizing the value of our interactions with patients, healthcare providers, payers, and regulatory agencies.Develop efficient analytic pipelines that include components related to dat a acquisition, exploratory analysis, feature engineering, modeling, and interactive storytelling.Produce actionable data presentations and visualizations for decision makers throughout the organizationCo-develop analytic products & other re-usable components that will serve as the foundation for a scalable approach for Pfizer's analytic maturationPartner with other Business Technology teams to define and execute technology POCs using innovative technologies to advance Pfizer's analytic capabilities Partner with other Data Science oriented groups within Pfizer to develop common tools & approaches through participation in formal/informal community of practice activitiesQualificationsBachelor's degree required, Master's degree preferred in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Biology, or similar field of study2-3 years prior work experience; Life Science and/or Technology experience preferredAbility to create technical examples, prototypes, and demonstrations based on rapidly changing data setsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced multi-disciplinary environment; with the ability to effectively communicate with a diverse audienceExperience with statistical modeling; specifically supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning techniquesExperience with Natural Language Processing algorithms and network analysisDemonstrated proficiency with SQL, Python or Scala, or JAVA as well as formal statistical tools R, SAS, etc.Demonstrated experience creating effective visualizations based on large datasets (e.g. Tableau, Spotfire, RShiny, Matplotlib)Exposure to software engineering design or API integration experience a plusExposure to Hadoop, Spark, graph databases and related tools focused on the distributed processing of large datasets (MPP RDBMS e.g. Teradata, Netezza, Exadata)Strong background in Software Engineering, Statistics, Biology, Economics or similar disciplinesNON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS10% travel to other Pfizer sites.Equal Employment OpportunityPfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirementsof the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.Job Type: Full-time

column18:
Zillow Group Business Analytics, Data Analyst (Data Mining, Tool Building, and Reporting) About the role:
Zillow is looking for a Data Analyst to support our consumer-facing product and marketing efforts. Since our early days, we have done a great job of attracting a large audience and providing that audience with engaging products to help them find the homes of their dreams. Now we need to focus on optimizing all of those efforts. In this role, you will help organize our data (billions and billions of rows from dozens of different sources) and develop reporting and optimization tools for other teams in the company to use every day. Teams from marketing and product, as well as executives, will use these tools to inform both daily decision-making as well as medium- and long-term strategy.
Your primary set of responsibilities will include two components: (1) ingest and re-organize data from a variety of sources and (2) build dynamic and scalable production tools and dashboards using tools like Tableau for teams across the company to use in both day-to-day operations as well as long-term strategy.
Partner with ZG marketing teams to develop tools that will help their daily campaign management as they seek to efficiently attract users to our site and apps.
Partner with product teams to build tools that will quickly identify the extent to which our product decisions are leading to their intended outcomes.
Partner with others within Analytics to turn insights and strategic objectives into trackable and actionable goals for others across the company.
Explore ZGÃ¢Â€Â™s complex databases, mining them to find insights that you can bring to your business partners.
Collaborate with Zillow GroupÃ¢Â€Â™s Data Science and Engineering team to streamline inefficiencies in the data preparation process.
As an analyst, you will be expect to learn new tools & techniques, attend Ã¢Â€Âœanalytics learning academyÃ¢Â€Â events, and share your specific expertise with the larger analytics group.
About the team:
The Business Analytics Team provides reporting and analytics services to Zillow Group. We help our partners understand the business from a data driven perspective.
We have the ability to make an immediate impact: Zillow is a data-hungry company and we rely on analytical results to support virtually all of our decisions. YouÃ¢Â€Â™ll have an opportunity to make real impacts on several parts of the business and will become an integral piece of the decision-making process.
We are a very flat organization that is growing quickly. You will communicate directly with Directors and VPs (probable even Spencer). You will have the opportunity to present results directly, and consumers will use your work to make important decisions.
While our goals are ambitious, we put a lot of effort into cultivating a fun work environment. We have a super smart and dynamic team from diverse backgrounds that will help you excel at Zillow and will help you develop a skillset useful across the industry. Who you are
WeÃ¢Â€Â™re looking for a seasoned analyst that has: (1) the technical skills to absorb and disentangle billions of rows of data, (2) the communication skills to work with a diverse set of partners to develop and implement multiple concurrent and complex project roadmaps, (3) the curiosity to push our entire company toward newer and better tools and ways of thinking, and (4) the tenacity to embrace and complete a challenging work stream.
Undergraduate or MasterÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. science, engineering, economics, finance, statistics, analytics).
You have 3-5 years of full-time, professional experience doing all the stuff below.
You are tremendous at writing SQL code against complex databases for the purpose of data extraction.
Extensive experience using Tableau Desktop to create self-service tools that drive decision-making, and are curious about (or have already used) other data visualization tools such as D3, Mode, or Interana.
You have extensive experience with several advanced analytics like Python and R.
You can translate business questions into problems solvable using analytics tools, and you enjoy converting the results of your analyses into visual stories tailored to the needs of your audience.
You hate inefficiency and seek to automate costly business & analytics processes using Python or another multipurpose language.
You have an interest in and willingness to do it all Ã¢Â€Â“ data engineering, Tableau reporting, ad hoc analyses, and project-based analytics.
You have strong written and verbal communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams.
You have project management experience during which youÃ¢Â€Â™ve worked with others to develop short-, medium-, and long-term roadmaps, outline actionable requirements, update project deliverables and timelines all while emphasizing issues related to efficiency, scalability, and overall usefullness.
Getting to know us
Zillow the leading real estate and rental marketplace dedicated to empowering consumers with data, inspiration and knowledge around the place they call home, and connecting them with elite local professionals who can help.
We care about one another and inspire each other to be successful. We collaborate in small teams to tackle big ideas, which gives everyone a chance to have an impact on what we do and how we do it.
Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.
column19:
Data Science Intern Ã¢Â€Â” Sony Pictures Television, Summer 2017 Internship
Overview:

Sony Pictures Television Research provides insights, analysis, and advisory across all lines of business. With a global team of over 40 professionals located in 5 offices around the world, we seek to transform the way we do business through data-driven approaches that create value for our clients and for the company.
Responsibilities:

Our team is building a big data platform and analytical solutions to support Sony PicturesÃ¢Â€Â™ global television division. We measure, analyze, and forecast the worldwide performance of TV shows on traditional and digital video platforms to gain deep insights that influence the production and distribution of our content. We are looking for a candidate to make a major impact by helping us answer our most complex business questions.

This position will work on the departmentÃ¢Â€Â™s data analytics program and drive projects involving predictive analytics. Your primary role will be to expand our data science practice by developing methods and models that help our business make smarter and more informed decisions.
Design statistical models leveraging internal and external data sets to predict the performance of content
Apply the appropriate tools, techniques, and data available to address key business questions
Conduct exploratory analysis to identify trends and opportunities across the television landscape
Share insights and implications of findings with senior leadership in the form of presentations, white papers, and written communication
Influence department strategy and roadmap as it relates to data science
Work closely with business and technical teams to prioritize analysis needs
Learn, grow, and develop using the latest technologies for data analysis (we use Tableau and Alteryx)
Opportunities to network, receive mentorship, and gain exposure to many parts of the business
Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in an analytical role dealing with large data sets
BA/BS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or other quantitative field
Proficiency in data mining and statistical modeling
Fluency in R or other statistical package
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau is a plus
Possess strong analytical aptitude, intellectual curiosity, and ability to work autonomously and collaboratively to solve problems
Program Information:

SPEÃ¢Â€Â™s Summer 2017 Internship is a 10 week full time program with two session starts, June 12-August 18 or June 26-September 1, 2017. All applicants must be enrolled in an accredited degree program for the entire duration of their internship and must be available for 40 hours per week for the full 10 week session.

Sony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics.

Nationwide is seeking a Sr Data Analytics Consultant to join its External Anti-Fraud Team. This individual will be accountable for building advanced predictive analytic solutions. The candidate MUST HAVE hands on development experience with Big Data (Hadoop) technologies, familiarity with Data Analysis and Data Science techniques, and knowledge of Claims Handling and/or the Insurance Industry. As a member of the Predictive Analytics Team, this individual may be involved with external data analytics across a variety of enterprise functions, which includes Underwriting, Claims, and Product. In addition, this individual will provide statistical consulting services to enterprise partners and will help with building our Enterprise External Anti-Fraud Data AnalyticsÃ¢Â€Â™ Road Map.
JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for leading business analytics projects supporting the business unit. Consults with business partners to define, structure and execute analytic projects. Analyzes trends and patterns in structured and unstructured data and synthesizes and communicates meaningful insights to the project team and business stakeholders using advanced techniques including data mining, predictive analytics and visualization. Develops and implement data management practices. May lead small multiple concurrent projects.
REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS: Reports to Manager level or higher. May have direct reports based on organizational structure. May be responsible for project teams.
CORE JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for creating, packaging, and communicating analytic work (synthesis) by developing new statistical models and using appropriate medium for relevant insights and applicable data visualizations.Use statistical techniques to determine patterns and predict future business outcomes and trends.
Responsible for effectively synthesizing own project work and the work of team members.Work may span more than one project or focus area.Plans and manages execution of own work, participates in planning, and delivers on commitments.Participates in the development of scope, risk/control matrix, project timelines, and assignments.
Collaborates with Leadership to develop analytic strategies for the business unit. Consults with business partners to understand, align, and deliver analytic work that supports business objectives and priorities.
Applies appropriate quantitative techniques and methods to solve business problems.Directs the application of appropriate quantitative techniques to facilitate repeatable research.Optimizes the use of analysis methods such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods to support business decisions.
Responsible for building analytic applications using statistical, database, and/or general programming languages and tools.Leverage technology for data management, report automation and/or ad hoc reporting for end users.
Develop and implement data management practices for structured and unstructured data sources.
Reviews analytic work papers and provide meaningful feedback and coaching throughout.May provide coaching and feedback to project team associates.
Build and maintain relationships and serve as a trusted business advisor to clients, internal risk partners, and other stakeholders.Create partnerships across the enterprise to ensure methodologies and assumptions used are aligned with corporate practices.
Actively contribute to the continuous improvement of department processes through ongoing initiatives.
Performs other duties as assigned.
MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS :
Education: Undergraduate studies in statistics, mathematics, analytics or related field with post graduate studies preferred.
Experience: Typically 8 or more yearsÃ¢Â€Â™ experience in data warehousing, statistical analysis and queries. Detailed experience with analytical problem solving; working with large structured and unstructured data sets and databases to identify trends and predict opportunities. Professional experience in insurance, financial services or a related industry preferred.
Knowledge: Understanding of and knowledge to conduct various statistical, econometric, quantitative analysis techniques. Advanced understanding of and working knowledge to conduct data management and extraction of large analytical platforms. Knowledge of quantitative theories and techniques and their role in business context. Relevant Property and Casualty industry or business knowledge is preferred.

Knowledge of statistical software and databases such as ACL, R, SAS, SPSS, MatLab, Teradata, Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, Netezza, etc. Understands data structures operational vs analytical data structures, normalization, etc. and SQL Assistant, WinSQL, and Toad, etc. Knowledge of general purpose programming languages (Python, Java, C++, etc) including domain specific languages, static and dynamic languages, application design and development, test driven development, and agile practices. Possesses an understanding of various operating system platforms (i.e., Windows 200X, UNIX, OS/400, etc.); relational database security concepts and platforms (i.e., Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server and DB2); enterprise network and systems architecture concepts and technologies; SDLC and generally accepted IT project management methodologies and approaches; and information security/protection concept.
Skills/Competencies: Possesses core statistics skills including an understanding of probability and its application to the analysis of data. Able to evaluate sources of variation and identify influential factors/features. Experienced with statistical process control, process monitoring and diagnostics. Ability to conduct data manipulation and analyses using analysis methods such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods. Ability to understand business processes and the data produced by them. Capable of developing distinctive data visualizations.

Critical Thinking and Problem Solving Ã¢Â€Â“ Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions, probes different sources for answers, and can see hidden problems. Ability to formulate business questions/problems into analytical questions, execute analyses and communicate recommendations.

Communication Ã¢Â€Â“ Excellent verbal and written communication skills to translate analytic findings into actionable communications. Able to clearly and succinctly communicate information and ideas through a variety of media in a manner that engages audiences at various levels and helps them understand and retain the message.

Time Management Ã¢Â€Â“ is able to plan and prioritize tasks, uses time effectively and efficiently, and can work on multiple concurrent projects.

Strategic Agility / Adaptable to Change Ã¢Â€Â“ can anticipate future consequences, has broad knowledge and perspective, is future oriented, and can paint credible visions of possibilities and likelihoods.
Values: Regularly and consistently demonstrates the Nationwide Values and Guiding Behaviors.
Staffing Exceptions to the above minimum job requirements must be approved by the: hiring managerÃ¢Â€Â™s leader and HRBP.
JOB CONDITIONS:
Overtime Eligibility: Not Eligible (Exempt)

Ability to communicate complicated analytical solutions clearly to non-analytic individuals one-to-one, in presentations and over email. Proven ability to apply analytic learnings to clear, impactful business actions

Analytics & Insights Coordinator - Jacksonville Jaguars (Jacksonville, FL)
Job Title : Analytics & Insights Coordinator
Department : Analytics
Reports To: Director of Analytics
Summary:
The Analytics & Insights Coordinator will work in the Analytics department, focusing on managing the design and development of internal reporting, dashboards, web apps, and surveys.
The Analytics team is responsible for analyzing, interpreting, presenting, and communicating data to enhance processes, decision-making, and outcomes for the Jacksonville Jaguars. This position is based in Jacksonville.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Define success metrics for internal tools and dashboards developed by the Analytics team

Establish reporting to monitor usage and engagement of tools and dashboards

Research user behavior of internal tools and recommend areas for change or further development

Design and conduct surveys to enhance customer intelligence, stadium product offerings, and internal product development

Perform ad-hoc data analyses

Build reports and dashboards to convey data and results of analyses
Job Qualifications:
Passion for creating visually-pleasing work products

Strong communication skills to allow for gathering information from multiple departments and defining project objectives

Strong attention to detail

Ability to assess problems and devise effective and creative solutions

Ability and motivation to drive a project from start to completion

Experience using SQL

Experience with R or Python

Experience using Tableau a plus

Experience with web development (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Django, Ruby, PHP, etc.) a plus

OUR Values (PRIDE) Ã¢Â€Â“ we foster a culture that promotes, and hire people that exhibit, the following values:

We are known for driving profitability and creating memorable experiences in new and unexpected ways. We use cutting-edge technology and analytics to achieve our goals.

Empowerment : We equip our people with opportunities and resources for growth. We want each person to become a leader in that personÃ¢Â€Â™s area of expertise and to be proactive at implementing solutions.
Working for the Jaguars : Ever wondered what working for the Jaguars would be like or what benefits you might expect as a member of the team? Of course, we have plans that offer customary benefits (like medical plans for eligible employees), but we also offer way more than the basics. Through our mentoring program, you have the opportunity to learn from one another

We care about you and your family

Employees have access to an Employee Assistance Program, the NFL Lifeline and our Ã¢Â€Âœsafe ridesÃ¢Â€Â program

We offer scholarship opportunities for your children

Our employees receive discounts from many of our vendors

We offer discounted tickets to our employees, and, if available, will provide tickets to our home games!

This position can be home based. Location flexible.

QuintilesIMS applies the breadth and depth of our service offerings along with extensive therapeutic, scientific and analytics expertise to help our customers navigate an increasingly complex healthcare environment as they seek to improve efficiency and effectiveness in the delivery of better healthcare outcomes. To learn more about Quintiles IMS, please visit

www.quintilesims.com

Within QuintilesIMS, the Global Services business unit has dedicated staff that consult with leading healthcare companies. As healthcare stakeholders increasingly need evidence to support design, development and prescribing decisions, the Advisory Analytics Health Economics and Outcomes Research (AA-HEOR) team offers sophisticated statistical and data analysis to meet our customerÃ¢Â€Â™s unique needs for clinical design and development insights.

PURPOSE

Provide advanced technical expertise to understand and translate analytic requirements and develop and maintain programs to meet internal and external clients' needs. Plan and execute project-related solutions including the full scope of programming tasks. Provide technical expertise on analysis of electronic medical record, claims, commercial, prescription and other data sources to the Global Services department.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform and plan: (i) the programming, testing, and documentation of programs for use in creating statistical tables, figures and listing, (ii) the programming of analysis dataset (derived datasets) and transfer files for internal and external clients, and (iii) the programming quality control checks for the source data and report the data issues periodically.

Detect errors in detail, correct them (e.g., review tables/listings, edit checks output and SAS programs to ensure quality of deliverable) and report it to internal or external clients.

Provide training and mentoring to AA-HEOR team members

All responsibilities are essential job functions unless noted as nonessential.

Qualifications

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ã‚Â·

Knowledge of statistics, programming or clinical trial research and drug development process

Ã‚Â·
In-depth knowledge of at least one of the following: epidemiology, health economics, electronic medical records, claims data, or health informatics.

Ability to implement programming specifications, as appropriate

Ability to estimate programming scope of work and assist in communicating project status

Experience with clinical coding systems, including ICD-9, ICD-10, CPT, RxNorm, and LOINC

Good organizational, interpersonal, leadership and communication skills

Ã‚Â·

Ã‚Â·

Excellent accuracy and attention to detail

MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

MasterÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in statistics, informatics, or related field and 3-5 yearsÃ¢Â€Â™ experience with electronic medical records or claims data

Who we are:
We create smart work.

Swift is a strategic creative agency that lives and breathes digital, leading brands forward with a groundbreaking combination of insights and ideas. We are hyper-focused on delivering campaigns that get results. Our client roster includes Starbucks, Google, NestlÃƒÂ©, and adidas.
Who you are:
Data Science is a core part of our overall Strategy team at Swift. We match this quantitative rigor with our Planning and Media/Comms capabilities to deliver unrivaled thinking to move our clients business forward.

Data Strategists mine datasets both big and small to surface meaningful insights and trends, benchmark previous behaviors and performance and even build predictive models of success for our clients. Data sets you will mine may include social media, survey, web/digital or business analytics. This role is highly collaborative and hands-on. You will work side-by-side other data strategists, strategic planners and comms planners.

As a Senior Data Strategist, you will help bring quantitative insights to life through data storytelling. Your audience is both our creative teams and our clients.
What youÃ¢Â€Â™ll do:Work on a core team with planning, strategy and community intelligence, provide overarching measurement strategy and framework for both digital and traditional channels
Outline goals and develop KPIs that track contentÃ¢Â€Â™s performance and ultimately demonstrate the channelÃ¢Â€Â™s impact to higher level business objectives
Work closely with analysts to derive insights from monthly and quarterly reporting and attend report presentations
Understand the opportunities and limitations of measurement across multiple social, digital and media platforms
Find new ways to present quantitative insights and strive to provide visualizations that tell a meaningful story
Using a sound methodology, understand how to build surveys that can be used to provide qualitative understanding and track quantitative results
Review, inform and guide brand tracker survey questions, cadence and insights with our clients to support their business and campaign tactics.
Work with analysts to outline our processes and procedures for uncovering insights from social listening and contextual analysis and oversee implementation of the program
Working with an analyst, outline a structure and process for content analysis and tagging and oversee the program launch
Take the lead in meetings, communicate a clear, defendable point of view, build relationships with new stakeholders, both internally and externally, and drive acceptance of SwiftÃ¢Â€Â™s measurement philosophy across large brands
What youÃ¢Â€Â™ll need:4-8 years direct experience to include:3+ years measuring and deriving insights from social channels, social campaigns and the surrounding ecosystem
4+ years analyzing engagement and performance data across digital mediums (social, web, paid media)
2+ years building, launching and analyzing surveys
Strong analytic and critical thinking skills, with an eye for detail
Understanding of the fundamentals of web, social media, and online advertising
Strong proficiency in analyzing and interpreting data, and uncovering actionable insights
Expert working knowledge of one or more analytics tools such as Sprinklr, Crimson Hexagon, or Sysomos
Strong presentation skills
Experience working with and mentoring analysts
SPSS or advanced statistical analysis a big plus
What We Offer:
Swift offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, vision, and dental coverage as well as flex spending and 401(k) matching. We're located in a unique space in Northwest Portland near a Portland Streetcar stop. We value our collaborative team environment and provide professional development opportunities. Our employees receive paid holidays and solid vacation/personal time. We have a dog-friendly office, provide our employees Monday breakfast and Friday lunch, and currently we have kombucha on tap.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Description

Are you curious by nature and have a passion for uncovering fascinating insights that inform practical business decisions? Do you excel at building predictive models using various data sources and techniques? Do you enjoy organizing information in a way that makes decision making easier for business leaders? Are you someone who can identify relationships in data where others thought none exist? Do you keep yourself on the cutting edge of research and statistical analysis?
The Compensation and Benefits group at Intel is seeking a statistical analyst to help us enhance our data analysis capabilities to support the business.
In this role you will be responsible for applying your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to uncover and share unique actionable insights.
You will generate new discoveries by organizing and integrating multisource data to test hypotheses and assumptions through statistical modeling.
You will develop and maintain dashboards that are actionable for our design teams and business leaders.
You will work closely with Compensation & Benefits Analysts/Consultants to tell the stories of our insights.

Qualifications

What you must have
A master's degree in statistics or a quantitative field Advanced Analytics, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Decision Sciences, Data Science, etc.
3+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis using standard statistical programs, such as JMP, SPSS, SAS, R, as well as Excel and data visualization software including Tableau
Experience in applying multiple advanced statistical techniques, including: multilevel analysis, factor analysis, cluster analysis, SEM, longitudinal data analysis, multiple linear and nonlinear regression, ordinal regression, and logistic analysis

What you might also have
Experience with SQL and data mining skills
Experience with Python or other programming languages

Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis Inside this Business Group

Intel's Human Resources group is responsible for hiring, developing and retaining the best and brightest employees while continuing to strengthen the company's culture and values. Intel Human Resources provides first-rate, cost-effective services and support to employees worldwide and is dedicated to advancing Intel's business goals.

Other Locations

Arizona, Phoenix; California, Santa Clara;

Posting Statement. Intel prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

column33:
The University of Washington (UW) is proud to be one of the nationÃ¢Â€Â™s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.

The Department of Medical Education and Biomedical Informatics provides training, research, and service in education and informatics across the breadth of health sciences and health care. Faculty interests and activities include: physician performance assessment, evidence based medicine, physician/patient communication skills, systems for clinical decision support, case based instruction, knowledge representation, retrieval and analysis, health professions diversity, public health informatics, health workforce projections, teaching and program evaluation and competencies for primary care.

The Department of Biomedical Informatics and Medical Education has an outstanding opportunity for a DATA INTEGRATION AND REPORTING ANALYST (Research Consultant) with its Medical Education and Evaluation division (MEE). This position will assist in the development and maintenance of systems to support an electronic student performance portfolio, proactive academic advising system, and learning environment monitoring system that will be the basis for reporting educational analytics to students, faculty, and administrators in the School of Medicine.

The Medical Education and Evaluation division, in conjunction with School of Medicine Academic and Learning Technologies (ALT), supports the operation of information systems for management of medical student academic progress information and related services including performance measurement, reporting, standards compliance, and data stewardship. They work with Dean of Medicine IT (DoM IT) in the development of data systems design, oversight, and development services.

The successful candidate will work with the MEE, ALT, and DoM IT to analyze, develop, deploy, and support conceptual, logical, and physical data models. The Data Integration and Reporting Analyst will use business and industry knowledge to translate the performance initiatives, both tactical and strategic, into business solutions as part of a team. The Data Integration and Reporting Analyst must be an exceptional communicator, both listener and presenter, and exercise his or her organizational relationship skills to deliver success.

The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, status as protected veterans, or status as qualified individuals with disabilities. At the University of Washington, diversity is integral to excellence. We value and honor diverse experiences and perspectives, strive to create welcoming and respectful learning environments, and promote access, opportunity and justice for all.
Responsibilities:
Develop plans for collection, data cleansing, and normalization of performance data to support management and reporting.
Develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models, and comprehensive documentation supporting these models.
Coordinate data models, dictionaries and other database documentation across applications.
Determine metrics/measures and/or ensure their application to support reporting and viewing needs of users.
Develop database reporting views, reports and visualizations to meet the needs of users.
Communicate, educate, and support development, architecture, and analysis staff for their understanding and use of database designs.
Represent group in efforts to share or integrate data designs with related SOM and University data systems.
Develop policies and procedures for support of new and ongoing systems to insure integrity of data.
Evaluate and recommend technology, tools, hardware and software solutions to accomplish the schoolÃ¢Â€Â™s data integration and reporting goals.

REQUIREMENTS:
Ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical associates
Understanding of the application and database development process including planning, analysis, design, coding, testing, and problem resolution
Ability to troubleshoot data issues related to deployment of relevant business solutions
Three years experiences in the field or related area
BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in information or data management, information management, computer sciences, or education
Coursework in statistics covering concepts of validity, reliability, and basic inferential statistics
Skills in data modeling, database / warehouse development and management
Experienced SQL development skills
Experience with SSIS or related tools for ETL and data processing / management
Experience in the design of data visualizations using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Work and thrive in a team environment, dealing with complex needs and ideas

DESIRED:
Experience in health sciences, higher education, or professional education settings strongly preferred
Advanced degree in information or data management, computer sciences or educational psychology

Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Criminal Conviction History, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select Ã¢Â€ÂœApply to this positionÃ¢Â€Â. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your Ã¢Â€ÂœMy JobsÃ¢Â€Â page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.

CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:
