The University of Washington (UW) is proud to be one of the nationÃ¢Â€Â™s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.

The Department of Medical Education and Biomedical Informatics provides training, research, and service in education and informatics across the breadth of health sciences and health care. Faculty interests and activities include: physician performance assessment, evidence based medicine, physician/patient communication skills, systems for clinical decision support, case based instruction, knowledge representation, retrieval and analysis, health professions diversity, public health informatics, health workforce projections, teaching and program evaluation and competencies for primary care.

The Department of Biomedical Informatics and Medical Education has an outstanding opportunity for a DATA INTEGRATION AND REPORTING ANALYST (Research Consultant) with its Medical Education and Evaluation division (MEE). This position will assist in the development and maintenance of systems to support an electronic student performance portfolio, proactive academic advising system, and learning environment monitoring system that will be the basis for reporting educational analytics to students, faculty, and administrators in the School of Medicine.

The Medical Education and Evaluation division, in conjunction with School of Medicine Academic and Learning Technologies (ALT), supports the operation of information systems for management of medical student academic progress information and related services including performance measurement, reporting, standards compliance, and data stewardship. They work with Dean of Medicine IT (DoM IT) in the development of data systems design, oversight, and development services.

The successful candidate will work with the MEE, ALT, and DoM IT to analyze, develop, deploy, and support conceptual, logical, and physical data models. The Data Integration and Reporting Analyst will use business and industry knowledge to translate the performance initiatives, both tactical and strategic, into business solutions as part of a team. The Data Integration and Reporting Analyst must be an exceptional communicator, both listener and presenter, and exercise his or her organizational relationship skills to deliver success.

The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, status as protected veterans, or status as qualified individuals with disabilities. At the University of Washington, diversity is integral to excellence. We value and honor diverse experiences and perspectives, strive to create welcoming and respectful learning environments, and promote access, opportunity and justice for all.
Responsibilities:
Develop plans for collection, data cleansing, and normalization of performance data to support management and reporting.
Develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models, and comprehensive documentation supporting these models.
Coordinate data models, dictionaries and other database documentation across applications.
Determine metrics/measures and/or ensure their application to support reporting and viewing needs of users.
Develop database reporting views, reports and visualizations to meet the needs of users.
Communicate, educate, and support development, architecture, and analysis staff for their understanding and use of database designs.
Represent group in efforts to share or integrate data designs with related SOM and University data systems.
Develop policies and procedures for support of new and ongoing systems to insure integrity of data.
Evaluate and recommend technology, tools, hardware and software solutions to accomplish the schoolÃ¢Â€Â™s data integration and reporting goals.

REQUIREMENTS:
Ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical associates
Understanding of the application and database development process including planning, analysis, design, coding, testing, and problem resolution
Ability to troubleshoot data issues related to deployment of relevant business solutions
Three years experiences in the field or related area
BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in information or data management, information management, computer sciences, or education
Coursework in statistics covering concepts of validity, reliability, and basic inferential statistics
Skills in data modeling, database / warehouse development and management
Experienced SQL development skills
Experience with SSIS or related tools for ETL and data processing / management
Experience in the design of data visualizations using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Work and thrive in a team environment, dealing with complex needs and ideas

DESIRED:
Experience in health sciences, higher education, or professional education settings strongly preferred
Advanced degree in information or data management, computer sciences or educational psychology

Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Criminal Conviction History, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select Ã¢Â€ÂœApply to this positionÃ¢Â€Â. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your Ã¢Â€ÂœMy JobsÃ¢Â€Â page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.

CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:
Appointment of the successful candidate to this position may be made contingent upon a satisfactory outcome of a criminal conviction history check .

The University of Washington is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.

The Data Analyst/Reporting Writer works within the Business Intelligence (BI) group and supports development activities in alignment with a corporate data strategy. The Data Analyst/Reporting Writer serves as a key technical resource in the development and delivery of data-oriented solutions to support critical business needs. This individual must be highly technical, with a good understanding of BI and data management principles, and must also be able to work with business and IT personnel to design, document and deploy the best technical solution within business timelines.
**Principal Responsibilities: **
Develops data delivery solutions using various BI solutions.
Works closely with, and takes direction from, Data Architects and ETL Engineers to build and modify data delivery solutions.
Works with peers to advance data management principles across the enterprise.
Troubleshoots issues with minimal guidance, identifies data related problems and provides scalable solutions.
Participates in the definition of application scope and objectives through research and fact finding.
Maintains productive working relationships with project sponsors and key systems users.
Supports work estimation process in support of development activities.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned or apparent.

The statements used herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by an employee in this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required by an incumbent so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company.
**Preferred Qualifications: **
Experience with large enterprise-grade ( >10TB) data warehouse solutions.
Experience working with Metadata, MDM, and Data Quality tool suites.
Experience with BI tools (Cognos, Hyperion, Microsoft SSRS, etc.).
Experience with Oracle Essbase.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik, Birst, Spotfire).
Experience with large database implementations (Oracle, SQL server, IBM, etc.)
Experience working with Cloud-based database solutions.
Experience with Big Data solutions including Hadoop.
Experience working with dimensional modeling and slowly changing dimensions.
Experience with SQL scripting languages (SSIS, PL/SQL, etc.).
Experience with predictive analytics and forecasting.
**Qualifications: **
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, IT or related field or minimum of 5 years of experience in a business or technical analysis role.
Minimum of 3 years of IT experience.
Experience demonstrating data management principles.
Experience working with SQL-based query tools.
Experience working with BI reporting software.
Experience working with data visualization software.
Experience working with relational database technology.
Experience working with large database environments ( >5TB).
**Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: **
Strong understanding of traditional BI tools such as Hyperion, Cognos, MicroStrategy, Business Objects, etc.
Good working knowledge of next generation, data visualization solutions (Birst, Spotfire, Tableau, Qlik, etc.).
Understanding of core data management principles, including Data Stewardship, Data Quality, Metadata Management, Master Data Management and Data Lineage.
Eager to learn about, and become subject matter expert in, data warehousing, data management, data quality and ETL architecture.
Willing to learn alternate data-oriented technologies and leverage these tools across multiple database technologies.
Strong analytical skills and focus on bottom-line results.
Effective interpersonal communication across various levels of the organization.
Ability to interpret, evaluate and communicate detailed information in a manner that is appropriate to the audience.
Ability to conduct root cause analyses and performance tuning for complex business processes and functionality.
Ability to interact with IT and business users across the organization to resolve issues and provide solutions in a timely manner.
**EEO Statement: **
Republic Services is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Clark Associates, Inc specializes in providing foodservice equipment and supplies to restaurants, hospitality, and healthcare businesses around the world. Products are sold through three channels of distribution including TheWebstaurantstore.com (Ecommerce Model), The Restaurant Stores (Cash and Carry Model), and Clark Food Service Equipment (Traditional Distribution Model). The procurement department is responsible for managing the 180,000 items available to our three distribution channels.
We are currently seeking a Data Reporting Analyst to join our growing Procurement Department, based in Lancaster, PA. The Data Analyst will provide insight and decision support to management. This position reports directly to upper management. The successful candidate must have an interest in working with a large amount of data, facts and figures and seeking an opportunity to add value to the company by analyzing a variety of data sources that lead to strategic recommendations. This position will work primarily with data involving pricing, inventory and logistics.
Job Tasks and Responsibilities:
Lead and conduct analytics projects, providing detailed analysis, both written and verbal.

Ensure data is carefully gathered
Interpret data, determine trends and come to new conclusions based on the findings
Conduct research and integrate findings into databases and reporting
Present findings and translate the data
Conduct all activities, including producing final presentations, with a high attention to detail

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Statistics, Math, or other quantitative field
Expert or Advanced level proficiency with Microsoft Excel.
Knowledge on building databases in Microsoft Access
Self-starter with ability to manage projects independently
Ability to handle fast-paced professional office environment

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Highly organized and strong attention to detail

No industry knowledge needed we will train you. Compensation includes competitive wages, a health care plan, 401K plan and paid time off. Other job perks include standing desks, on site gym, commercial kitchen in break room and monthly theme lunches and social events. Please include a cover letter with your application.
column41:
This Job is eligible for the following work arrangements: Flex Time

Are you passionate about working with Big Data to solve business problems that directly impact our customers? Are you excited about gaining new insights & intelligence, and answering critical questions based on data?

Hundreds of millions use Outlook daily, we are on a mission to make it a billion. This mission takes us to meet our customers where they are: on all platforms (Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, Web) and through all service providers (Gmail, Yahoo, Outlook.com, Office365, etc.). We are currently working with big data and building tools and models to extract relevant business information to help us reach our organizational goals like grow usage (MAU), grow cross client usage (i.e. mobile + desktop), and monetization (i.e. sell and retain Office 365 subscriptions).

We are looking for a talented and experienced data analyst who can mine data and provide key insights to optimize growth and usage while we experiment with new ways to upsell or renew users to the various subscription offerings.

Key tasks and responsibilities:

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Work with the product team to define, track and report key product metrics.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Provide quick turnaround data analysis to generate insights to help guide decision-makers and executives.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Build a data analysis practice with both full- and self-service models for investigations, and a regular engagement rhythm to empower the entire organization with data-driven decisions.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Present and communicate broadly across the product groups to drive the future strategy for Outlook grounded in analytics.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Work side-by-side with other feature PMs to empower their own data explorations and growth experiments.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Help develop the skills of the entire team as data-savvy leaders who ask great questions and make informed decisions.

Requirements:

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Self-starter with a strong passion for using data to influence business decisions and strategy investments.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ 3-5 years of demonstrated success in data science or business analytics.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Excellent in Excel and writing SQL queries for data manipulation.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Strong skills in languages such as Python and/or R. Experience in C#/C++ or similar languages is a strong plus.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Ability to intelligently integrate a wide range of data sources and analysis to answer core business questions and discover growth opportunities.

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to present and discuss data models and analysis to a range of audiences across development, operations and business teams in Microsoft

Ã¢Â€Â¢ Exceptional ability to effectively negotiate and collaborate across teams and organizations

Ã¢Â€Â¢ BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in a quantitative field (Sciences, Engineering, Economics, etc.);

Ã¢Â€Â¢ MasterÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in a quantitative field preferred but not required.

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:

Microsoft Cloud Background Check:

This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

The Manager, Data Management position will be a key member of the new and growing function of Customer Data Strategy charged with building a foundational, world class team of deep analytical intelligence including internal data science expertise. This person will report into the Associate Vice President of Customer Data Strategy, part of the enterprise global Marketing division. He/she will be part of an inaugural team of peers that includes Data Strategy and Execution focused on elevating the NBA's use of analytics, predictive modeling, data visualization, and influence to take both our teams and our league to the next level with a vision of 'deepening engagement with fans, both prospective and existing, that builds a lifetime love of the game'. This will involve leveraging many different but related data streams along with future streams to inform a single view of the fan across the NBA's global touchpoints including both on and offline platforms and channels.

Major Responsibilities:
Partner with colleagues in Customer Data Strategy and with business partners to meet data requirement needs for a variety of projects
Own data sourcing, cleansing, transforming, enriching processes relevant to specific analyses and business processes
Access data from internal and third party tools to develop data aggregations that accelerate insights and actions for the business
Work to create repeatable processes so views and output files are available on an as needed basis
Support data science and marketing staff in building data sets to support reporting and advanced analytics projects

Required Experience & Knowledge:
Required Skills/Knowledge:
Computer Science degree and application with relevant data management experience
Expert-level data engineering / development skills (including SQL, Java/Python, PHP)
Experience with scalable "big data" technologies (Hadoop, Spark, mongoDB)
Experience in Windows & Linux (and UNIX) operating systems in server environments
Experience in data acquisition from external sources (AWS S3, Dropbox), API (json/xml), FTP/SFTP, etc.
Excellent data analysis skills; candidate must understand business perspective of the data you are working with
Excellent communication skills. Candidate must be comfortable speaking directly with members of Customer Data Strategy, marketing colleagues and business partners
Experience Needed :
A minimum of 5 -8 years in data management. Support of CRM functions a plus
Experience partnering with data scientists and statisticians to drive business outcomes
Experience in data warehousing concepts like data modeling and architecture

Educational Background Required:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, CIS / MIS, or related engineering or technical fields
Advanced degree preferred but not necessary

IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.
Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM. The Public Service Sector consulting practice is a trusted advisor to federal, state and local governments, partnering to meet challenges and responding quickly to citizen demands, business needs, new economic conditions, and changing legislative priorities and policies.

Critical trends are driving significant changes in workforce management with talent being a strategic priority, emerging technologies (cloud, mobile, social becoming pervasive), employees demanding a greater level of engagement and organizations looking to explicitly link HR and Learning process to business performance with analytics. IBM's Talent & Change consulting services help clients build a smarter, more connected workforce with offerings that align to the CHRO and CLO priorities and the challenges of buyers from across the C-Suite. If you are ready for the challenge and excitement this growth area offers, we want to talk to you!

As an Application Training and Learning Consultant at IBM, you'll team with some of the best minds in the industry to create innovative high quality solutions focused on clients' business needs. You'll do this using your knowledge and expertise to design and model processes, develop solutions, and integrate them with applications.

The Application Training and Learning Consultant is responsible for:
Working with clients towards defining a solution that will meet the agreed requirements including assessing LMS architecture, performing gap analysis, conducting feasibility studies, and verifying/confirming requirements to produce options/recommendations.

Utilizing current learning principles/concepts, instructional design theory/evaluation methods and training technics/technologies available to support development, delivery, administration, and evaluation for example utilizing the industry-recognized Instructional Systems Design (ISD) such as the ADDIE model.

Creating instructor-led, web-based, and blended learning solutions comprised of training estimates, presentations, procedures, exercises, quick references, simulations, instructor guides, curriculums, course outlines, prototypes, and training design specifications.

Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.

Requisition #: 171621
Title: Data Analyst, Performance, Analysis and Reporting
Department: Performance Reporting
Posting Date: January 12, 2017
Status: Exempt
Hours: 40 hrs. M-F 8:30-5:00
Location: UMass Memorial Medical Center Ã¢Â€Â“ 1 Mercantile Street, Worcester, MA
UMass Memorial Medical Center is the region's trusted academic medical center, and part of the UMass Memorial Health Care system. We are committed to improving the health of people in Central Massachusetts through excellence in care, comprehensive health services, teaching and research.
Position Summary:

Under the direction of the Manager of Reporting and Analysis, the Data Analyst, Performance Analysis and Reporting will develop and deploy data analyses, reports and quality improvement projects on behalf of the Managed Care Network and the Accountable Care Organization.
Position Qualifications:

Bachelors level degree and minimum of 2 years experience in complex data analyses. Experience with Microsoft Access and Excel required. Experience with SPSS preferred. Demonstrated ability to plan, organize, and execute complex projects. Experience in health care quality improvement initiatives. Ability to collaborate with IT professionals in development of decision support tools. Position requires a high level of attention to detail, excellent analytic and organizational skills. Incumbent will have frequent written and verbal communication with clinical, educational, and managed care audiences, and work closely with internal and external information technology professionals.
Major Responsibilities:

Conducts or assists in routine or ad-hoc reporting and data analyses as assigned for the delivery of accurate, timely and actionable information to physicians and administrators to support the improvement of care delivery within the UMass Memorial system.

Ensures accuracy of reports and analyses by testing data reliability and validity.

Produces thorough documentation, consistent with department standards, of all reports and analyses.

Works closely with internal IT staff and external IT vendors in development of decision support/reminder and performance reporting system.

Maintains timelines and ensures success of improvement project deliverables as assigned by Medical Management.

Effectively communicates with key stakeholder communities using multiple channels: verbal, written, and electronic.

Ensures teamwork, communication and mission focus in the management of assigned areas.

Participates in performance improvement initiatives and demonstrates the use of quality improvement in daily operations.

Ensures compliance with the ACO and Managed Care Network policies and regulatory agencies such as Joint Commission, DPH, etc. Develops and maintains procedures necessary to meet regulatory requirements.

Ensures that department complies with hospital established policies, quality assurance programs, safety, and infection control policies and procedures.

Develops and maintains established departmental policies, procedures, and objectives.

Ensures compliance to all health and safety regulations and requirements.

Respects diverse views and approaches, and contributes in maintaining an environment of professionalism, tolerance, civility and acceptance toward all employees, patients and visitors.

Performs similar or related duties as required or directed.
All responsibilities are essential job functions.

Job Description

Want to analyze numbers and curate data with one of the leading data companies in Seattle? We are looking for a self-motivated Data Analyst with a passion for solving analytical problems and communicating nuanced findings to non-technical audiences . If this sounds like you, come join our Data Analytics team based in Pioneer Square! Our data and software are revolutionizing the compensation world with a crowd-sourced and machine-learned approach to salary data analysis. As a data driven company, our data is our lifeblood and we want someone to join us in the journey of discovering what amazing things it has to offer.

What youÃ¢Â€Â™ll do
Participate in creating innovative and highly visible analyses of work trends and compensation, like PayScale's Gender Pay Gap Package .
Select and analyze data subsets of the PayScale database of over 54 million profiles, using our real-time data analysis system.
Find trends, stories, and highlights in a large multivariate dataset.
Partner with PayScaleÃ¢Â€Â™s marketing team to brainstorm concepts, craft research questions for the PayScale salary survey, and produce clean data visualizations to present the data.
Work with media partners and journalists to understand their information requirements and provide the needed data or analysis.
May w ork with the broader data analytics team responsible for several areas of our business, including data health and wealth, our proprietary compensation model (currently supporting over 5,0 00 customers and millions of website visitors), business intelligence analytics, and survey design.
May develop analytical and statistical approaches to answer business questions, examine data validity, and report on interesting data subjects.
Receive a personalized unicorn avatar. Qualifications

What youÃ¢Â€Â™ll need

A bachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree (preferably from the sociology, psychology, anthropology, political science, or economics) with substantial quantitative coursework.
0-1 years of experience.
Excitement about both data and information design.
A desire to craft informative, easy-to-use, a nd highly intriguing data visualizations, after completing any necessary training.
Experience creating quantitative answers to questions of business interest.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Well-organized and detail-oriented, with good time management skills.
Able to work independently in a dynamic, fast-paced, start-up environment.
Proficiency in Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, D3, etc.) is a plus.

Additional Information

PayScale is an equal opportunity employer Ã¢Â€Â“ Minority/Female/Veteran/Disability, we provide a place where employees of all backgrounds can build a successful career.

About PayScale
We are committed to providing a true work-life balance and we offer competitive vacation and flex time to support that. We work hard, but still want coworkers to be able to have interesting lives outside of the office. Our team includes a certified Zumba instructor, an all-star soccer player and coach, a Jeopardy master/Bachelorette superfan, an ultramarathoner, an ageless wonder, and more. Oh so much more.
We maintain a supportive, inclusive, and laid-back work environment, because stress is the enemy of creativity.
We support employees who want to take part in charitable giving, in all scopes of life.
We have a broad mix of optional-but-encouraged fun company activities available: holiday parties, family picnics, zoo trips, coffee carts, Halloween costume contests, and more!
We believe we are the ideal company for somebody who wants to avoid the bureaucracy that comes with huge organizations and the risk and stressful work hours of tiny startups. Come to a place where your ideas are valued, your brain is challenged, your voice is heard and your work has an immediate impact.

Pay is a Package!
In addition to competitive salaries, PayScale offers the following benefits and perks.
Benefits:
Unlimited Paid Time Off policy
100% company paid medical/vision/dental/prescription premiums for employees (50% for eligible dependents and partners)
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations
Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability, and Company-paid Life Insurance
Maternity and Paternity Leave
10 paid holidays!
401k with company match
Perks:
Casual dress code (JSS - Jeans, shorts, and sandals welcome!)
Onsite lockers, showers, and clothes dryer
Bike storage
Coworkers you actually like...
Gender neutral bathrooms on most floors
Mothers' Room
Sitting-Standing ergo friendly desks
Weekly company sponsored happy hours
Fido Fridays (our canine colleagues join us the first Friday of every month. WOOF!)

The Reservations Performance Reporting and Data Analytics Co-op position will provide analytical and process-driven support to Reservation Sales, Customer Care, and Social Media. The position develops, analyzes, and builds reports in order to create goals and measure performance. Implements solutions to streamline and automate reporting processes, including building and manipulating datasets, SQL programming using SAS, and utilizing data visualization and business intelligence tools. Candidate must possess strong technical skills, with an emphasis on Excel, SQL, creating datasets, database querying and report development tools (SAS, Tableau, Hyperion, or other relevant data extraction tools). Must be a strong team player, detail oriented, and perform well under pressure. Candidate must convey professional image to all levels of associates. University Hospitals (UH) is a community-based healthcare system which serves patients at more than 150 locations throughout Northern Ohio, including seven wholly owned and four affiliated hospitals.

Committed to advanced care and advanced caring, UH encompasses the regions largest network of primary care physicians, outpatient centers and hospitals. The network also offers specialty care physicians to treat almost every disease and condition, skilled nursing, elder health, rehabilitation and home care services, and occupational health and wellness. University Hospitals is the second largest private sector employer in Northeast Ohio and is within the top five largest private sector employers in the state of Ohio.

This position is responsible for overseeing, organizing, and optimizing population data used to help drive strategic decisions and work activities for University Hospitals Accountable Care Organizations
Activities include:Organize population reports from various data sources into standard work packages used by service line leadership to determine most effective work activities to impact population health.

Perform independent analysis of data to identify trends and make recommendations to impact population.
Effectively collaborate with UH Quality Center, UH IT&S, and other UH service lines to develop consolidated data analytics deliverables, solutions, and reports.
Organize and facilitate regular data exchanges with Centers for Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) and third party insurers.
Work with ACO leaders and IT&S leaders / team members to help develop long-term UH data solutions.
Help analyze, organize, and prepare physicians scorecard data used to distribute incentive payments.
Assist UH ACO Network Administrator with reviewing and organizing data for physician network(s).
Independently manage projects and assignments which advance service lines strategic goals.

Experience working multiple health care data sources that include Electronic Medical Record application(s), registration and scheduling systems, and medical claims systems.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proven time management and organizational skills.
Demonstrated excellence in customer service.

Demonstrated ability to apply concepts, utilize sound judgment and work independently.

Flexible and creative work approach.

We believe that , when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every clientÃ¢Â€Â™s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of Ã¢Â€Â˜own your tomorrowÃ¢Â€Â™ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.

As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future.
Our Opportunity:
Do you want to be part of a Data Warehouse team managing over 120 terabytes of data for a leading financial firm with over $2.5 trillion in assets under management? At Schwab, the Global Data Technology (GDT) organization governs the strategy and implementation of the enterprise data warehouse and emerging data platforms. We help Marketing, Finance and executive leadership make fact-based decisions by integrating and analyzing data. We need entry-level developers who are interested in data engineering to work on ETL (Extract / Transform/Load) processes using various industry-leading tools and technologies.
What youÃ¢Â€Â™ll do:
You will work on new projects to understand, design and develop new code to integrate and transform data in our Enterprise Data Warehouse. You will engage in discussions about data modeling concepts and best practices. You will learn to understand the core business concerns and provide solutions to achieve project results. You will develop code using a variety of best-in-class data technologies including Informatica and Teradata while also learning Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Sqoop, Python, Hive, Kafka etc. You will also learn the data warehouse development process and agile development methods.
Detailed duties include:
Working with Business Systems Analysts, Data Modelers and DBAs to ensure a solid understanding of requirements

Creating/updating ETL specifications and supporting documentation

Developing ETL logic utilizing Informatica workflows, scripting and load utilities

Performing testing tasks and peer reviews

Building deep understanding of the warehouse data and capabilities
What you have:Our team members will have:
Prior experience reading and writing SQL ( >1 year)

Experience, education or training on database concepts and technologies

Deep interest and passion for data, analytics, and big data

Familiarity or basic training in data modeling (logical and/or physical)

Experience or knowledge in data warehousing concepts

Experience or knowledge of programing and scripting languages is a plus

Prior experience working in a team environment

Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, prioritization, and decision-making skills and the ability to be a self-starter

Excellent written/verbal communication skills

Strong knowledge of MS Excel and MS Word along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required

Zelis is a healthcare information technology company and market-leading provider of end-to-end healthcare claims cost management and payment solutions.

COMPANY BACKGROUND/CULTURE

Zelis Healthcare is an information technology company which utilizes an end-to-end technology platform to fulfill the claims cost management and payments needs of healthcare payors including large and medium-sized health plans, TPAs, Taft-Hartley Plans, providers and individuals. The company provides a comprehensive portfolio of network management, claims integrity, payment remittance solutions and analytical services for medical, dental and workers' compensation claims to over 500 payor clients. Additionally, the company delivers electronic payments and explanation of payments to over 200,000 healthcare providers and serves individuals with provider lookup and medical referral services.

Position Overview

Zelis is pursuing an aggressive organic and non-organic growth strategy focused on providing superior healthcare claim lifecycle solutions to payors, providers and individuals from pre-payment through payment. As the company executes its growth strategy, Zelis is seeking to identify an accomplished Business Analytics Associate . Reporting directly to the Director of Compliance, and working closely with managers and other team members.

SUMMARY

The position requires expert level data analytics ability to manipulate large amounts of data, analyze reports, and tell a story from the data. Strategy and Analytics will be involved with critical decisions which will shape the strategy, direction, and business decisions. This role will include management and leadership initiatives supporting strategy analytics, model governance and Client support. One of the main objectives will be to build strong consistent and sustainable analytic solutions, information support and insight in collaboration with cross-functional teams.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Understand and leverage existing reports, logic, equations, and data mining to connect reporting elements

Define business requirements for new reports

Create mockup of new reports based on business and Client needs

Leverage all levels of the organization to meet tight deadlines

Ensure data is accurate and challenge inconsistencies

Obtain sign off of rationale and logic on requested reports and deliverables from senior executives

Lead strategic projects and initiatives

Support Client relationship reviews with creative data manipulation and charting/ presentations

Attend select client meetings to understand needs

Reviews, updates and maintains financial opportunities, risks and forecasts

Provide in-depth, sophisticated analysis to define problems and apply ingenuity to develop innovative and creative solutions

Support and influence strategic business decisions that impact the business

Provide ongoing reports for volumes with accuracy and quality

Responsible for MIS validation during audits and reviews including KPI development/monitoring to ensure model are accurately reflecting resource needs

Assist the CFO with all financial reporting related to implementations, provider statistics and other miscellaneous data requests.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS

Expert level knowledge of excel and power point required

Subject matter expertise in business, planning and analysis

Proven ability to lead complex projects, develop innovate solutions, execute a strategic plans and deliver superior results

Proven ability to present complex ideas, negotiate and influence senior leaders across diverse functions

Experience in handling large data sets

Experience in handling complex data models with interdependencies

Experience with SQL a plus
COMPENSATION:
An attractive compensation package as well as comprehensive benefits plans are available to attract outstanding candidates.

Thank you for your interest in the Zelis team!

Data Miner

The Data Miner is a specialist in the analysis, manipulation, and presentation of complex data to answer specific business questions. They typically have a strong statistical background, and may be a statistician by training. However, their work includes the entire process of data analysis, including the data cleansing, data preparation and visualization of results. Data Miners are extremely detail-oriented and focused, but are able to understand the context in which their analysis will eventually fit, and use that to guide their work. The Data Miner is comfortable working with very large and often ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢Â‚Â¬Ã…Â“messyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢Â‚Â¬? data sets and enjoy the process of bringing order out of chaos.

column68:
Bio-Rad is looking for a Summer Intern-Data Science.
What you'll be doing:

This position is in the IT group, located in Hercules, CA. You will partner with GSC executives, managers and analytics to clearly understand the business problem, define decisions & actions that will be enabled by predictive analytics & determine scope of work. You will research and document existing data, current business processes and methods. You will transform the problem statement from a business domain into a computational domain. You will research and identify an appropriate subset of theoretical frameworks that are applicable to the computational problem domain. You will plan and execute a narrowly scoped POC to test the feasibility and likelihood of solving the business problem.
What you need for this role:
Currently enrolled in Master's program in Statistics, Math, Physics, Computer Science with plans to return to school in the following term (you are not eligible for this program if you have already graduated)
Experience programming in R or Python
Have a grade point average of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale)
Eligible to work in the United States
Be willing to make a full-time commitment of 40 hours a week for 10 weeks from mid June to mid August.
About Bio-Rad:

Bio-Rad is a global leader providing a broad array of clinical diagnostics and life science research products. With a team of more than 7,800 employees and a global network of operations serving our customers, we help people live longer, healthier lives.

Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster, better results.

EEO/AA Employer/Veterans/Disabled/Race/Ethnicity/Gender/Age

To all recruitment agencies: Bio-Rad does not accept agency resumes, unless the agency has been authorized by a Bio-Rad Staffing Representative. Please do not submit resumes unless authorized to do so. Bio-Rad will not pay for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
column69:
At AstraZeneca, we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We're focused on the potential of science to address the unmet needs of patients around the world. We commit to those areas where we think we can really change the course of medicine and bring big new ideas to life. As a

Business Intelligence and Data Analyst (Analytics Analyst) Immuno Oncology

in

Gaithersburg MD

, you'll play a pivotal role in channeling our scientific capabilities to make a positive impact on changing patients' lives. North American Commercial is the 'face' of

AstraZeneca and MedImmune to our many healthcare clients. They represent many of the most well recognized and respected products in the industry, and build strong relationships with healthcare professionals.

AstraZenecaÃ¢Â€Â™s vision in

Oncology

is to help patients by redefining the cancer-treatment paradigm, with the aim of bringing six new cancer medicines to patients between 2013 and 2020. A broad pipeline of next-generation medicines is focused principally on four disease areas - breast, ovarian, lung and hematological cancers. As well as other tumor types, these are being targeted through four key platforms - immunotherapy, the genetic drivers of cancer and resistance, DNA damage repair, and antibody drug conjugates, underpinned by personalized healthcare and biomarker technologies.

In a completely hands-on role, you will be primarily responsible for providing rapid data access and reporting to the Commercial Organization with expertise in manipulating, integrating & aggregating large complex data sets.

We are looking for someone who is a data specialist with a passion for data quality, automation and an ability to easily develop quick data pipelines from extraction to reporting. You will be deployed as part of the Business Insight & Analytics team and will report to an Insight Director within the Oncology therapeutic area. Further you will be aligned to an Advanced Analytics Manager within the team for onboarding to our systems, data education, learning best practices in data organization & professional development.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

You will be responsible for extracting, combining and aggregating transaction-level data sets from disparate sources and formats (both relational databases and flat files) into data cubes optimized for rapid access to key measures & metrics allowing for on demand deep-dive views of the business.

Develop & build fit-for-purpose custom data pipelines to support the cross-functional needs of Forecasting, Primary Research, Performance Assessment & Advanced Analytics initiatives extending to Marketing teams.

Perform ad-hoc data investigation & queries to address an immediate business question and report data via cross-tabs, pivot tables, charts, basic statistics, distributions & correlations. Also, automate reports and build interactive dashboards if certain ad-hoc requests are needed on a regular basis.

Support the development, distribution and maintenance of standard set of Brand Performance Reports and Dashboards using appropriate reporting, visualization and data automation tools.

Manage timely delivery of processed data and information for data-driven Marketing & Sales initiatives such as segmented custom target lists for Marketing Research, Multi-Channel Campaigns Sales Force Targeting and Resource allocation with inputs from the Advanced Analytics team.

Own regular evaluation of all data sources being leveraged to ensure integrity and quality of the data, actively maintaining data dictionaries & metadata definition.

Actively participate and influence continuous improvements to CompanyÃ¢Â€Â™s Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence solutions with a strong motive for eliminating redundant manual data extraction and processing.
Essential Requirements:
BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s Degree required; preferably in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics or relevant Quantitative field. Advanced degree is a plus.

3+ years of experience in a data-rich environment; preferably using SQL/SAS for data extraction, processing, manipulation, query & reporting with a demonstrated practical knowledge of building analytical databases and management. Proficiency in SQL & SAS will be tested during the interviews.

2+ years of preferred experience in the Pharmaceutical / Biotech / Healthcare industry. Specifically, proficiency in manipulating and extracting insights from large longitudinal data sources, such as Medical/Pharmacy Claims, EMR and other patient level data sets.

Experience in building clean and simple automated reports in Excel and PowerPoint.

Experience in data modeling and developing dashboards/reports in QlikSense or MicroStrategy. Similar experience with other BI tools is strongly preferred

Experience with data warehousing (e.g. storage methods/formats, database design) preferred

Knowledge of Python and big data technology - Hadoop ecosystem (Cloudera distribution - Impala, Hive, Pig, Hbase, Spark, MapReduce etc.)

Next Steps -- Apply today!

To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience -- it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law.

column72:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to share, and make the world more open and connected. Through our growing family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that helps billions of people around the world connect and share what matters most to them. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to make the world more open and accessible. Connecting the world takes every one of usÃ¢Â€Â”and we're just getting started. Facebook is seeking a Visiting Scientist to join our Infrastructure team. Term length would be considered on a case-by-case basis. Contribute research that can be applied to Facebook Big Data Systems
Devise better big data analytics infrastructure systems As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Facebook is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com or you may call us at 1+650-308-7837.

The Solutions Group global teams are located across multiple countries, and our role is to provide innovation, products, and technical consulting with the business across various regions, practices, and cultures. Therefore, it will be necessary to work well with team members across differing time zones and countries.

You will have a primary focus on data integration, architecture, and quality of our Hadoop/Cazena cloud-based data system.

rain our existing DNA developers, as well as sharing any experience and knowledge on these tools.

column74:
Advisory Board Survey Solutions is the Advisory Board Company's full-service suite of perceptual surveys, action planning tools, analysis and support. Drawing on the best insights from across the Advisory Board, ABSS focuses on connecting members' survey data with actionable, proven best practices through a best-in-class technology platform, dedicated advisor support and intuitive action planning templates. This unique program is one of the fastest growing areas within Research and Insights.

Our current opportunity is based in Washington, DC.
Specific Responsibilities:Develop expertise over multiple survey research products for U.S. and International members
Build excel-based research reports and design custom surveys on a range of topics across healthcare
Analyze raw data to visualize organizational trends and utilize statistical methods to generate insights
Create custom data reports for members using results reporting site and data analysis software
Administer and act as content expert for comprehensive engagement databases composed of detailed opinion, organizational structure and demographic information; create, update and query databases
Provide technical and analytic expertise to members
Solve technical and data issues and perform root cause analysis and identify and implement corrective and preventive measures
Basic Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree
Excellent academic record
Minimum 1 year of professional experience
Experience with at least two of the following:
Project management experience
Experience managing multiple clients or projects
Demonstrable analytical reasoning or quantitative analysis
Knowledge of analytic tools (Excel, SQL, R, Python, Stata)
Ideal Qualifications:Ability to communicate with clients and team members both written and orally
Experience with opinion or perceptual survey administration or design
Experience in the healthcare industry
About Advisory Board:
Advisory Board is a best practices firm that uses a combination of research, technology, and consulting to improve the performance of 4,400+ health care organizations. Headquartered in Washington, D.C., with offices worldwide, Advisory Board forges and finds the best new ideas and proven practices from its network of thousands of leaders, then customizes and hardwires them into every level of member organizations, creating enduring value. For more information, visit www.advisory.com.

We are a workplace that...

Values and celebrates

diversity of experience, culture, and opinion

Is committed to creating an inclusive environment to enhance our collective experience

Promotes a supportive community through staff-led affinity groups, events, and educationÃ¢Â€Â‹
Culture & Values:
We think

Forbes

said it best

: Ã¢Â€ÂœMaking the world a better place is what The Advisory Board Company is all about.Ã¢Â€Â We have a unique culture where employees are told to

avoid after work emails

, encouraged to take 10 hours per month of paid leave for

community service

, and are asked to add surplus value in every interaction with a member or colleague.

Over the past thirty years, we have developed a distinctive corporate culture based our

values and principles

. Eavesdrop on a conversation among Advisory Board teammates--or a performance review, or a planning session Ã¢Â€Â“ and you're likely to hear phrases such as "running toward criticism" and "the power of language" used with sincerity and even passion. We function on a meritocracy Ã¢Â€Â“ we award, promote, and praise based on individual performance, capabilities, and ambition. We provide ways for staff to share their time, talent, and passions in the community. We reward innovation and foster a collaborative environment. We have a high bar for talent, a performance-driven staff, and peers that constantly challenge one another in the workplace. And we want free-thinkers, agile speakers, witty writers, and team players to join the firm Ã¢Â€Â“ and make an impact in industries that matter to everyone.
Benefits:
Consistent with our belief that our employees are our most valuable resource, The Advisory Board Company offers a competitive benefits package.
Medical, dental, and vision insurance, dependents eligible
401(k) retirement plan with company match
20+ days paid time off and 10+ paid company holidays
Daytime leave policy for community service or fitness activities (up to 10 hours a month each)
Wellness programs including gym discounts and incentives to promote healthy living
Dynamic growth opportunities with merit-based promotion philosophy
Benefits kick in day one,

see the full details here
column75:
-

170025893

Job Description

JP Morgan Chase
JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at

http://www.jpmorganchase.com/

.

Our Firmwide Risk Function

Our Firmwide Risk function is focused on cultivating a stronger, unified culture that embraces a sense of personal accountability for developing the highest corporate standards in governance and controls across the firm. Business priorities are built around the need to strengthen and guard the firm from the many risks we face, financial rigor, risk discipline, fostering a transparent culture and doing the right thing in every situation. We are equally focused on nurturing talent, respecting the diverse experiences that our team of Risk professionals bring and embracing an inclusive environment.

CCB Risk

Chase Consumer & Community Banking (CCB) serves consumers and small businesses with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, small business banking and lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice.

Consumer & Community Banking Risk Management partners with each CCB sub-line of business to identify, assess, prioritize and remediate risk.

Types of risk that occur in consumer businesses include fraud, reputation, operational, credit, market and regulatory, among others.

This position is part of the CCB Risk Analytics organization within Consumer & Community Banking Risk Management. Our mission is to make better customer-level risk decisions through the use of data from across all of the Retail and Wholesale customer bases within the Consumer & Community Bank and the Commercial Bank

Description

Senior Consumer Risk Data Analysts on the Data Infrastructure & Engineering team are responsible for identifying relevant data elements, running analysis to transform and enrich the data, and constructing optimally designed data products to be used in analysis and/or operational risk decisions. The candidate must exhibit a thorough understanding of data structures, data manipulation, and data quality management. In addition, the candidate must have a solid understanding of CCB businesses, functions, systems, data environments, and processes that are necessary for the production and utilization of customer data.

The candidate must have the ability to partner with stakeholders inside and outside of the department to understand their needs and design and develop robust analytical data solutions that meet and/or exceed customer expectations. The ideal candidate will possess JPM institutional data and system knowledge, technical skills, an understanding of data science, and a commitment to producing high quality results.
LI-POST

Qualifications

Educational Requirement
Degree in a quantitative field: Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Biostatistics, Operations Research, Computing and Information Theory, Industrial / Electrical Engineering, or equivalent

Required Skills

7+ years of experience in risk data management, business analysis, or business reporting

A strong desire to learn how performance is measured across the various businesses we support
Expert in SQL, Unix, and at least one of: SAS, R, Hive, SparkSQL, Sqoop, or other query languages

Experience in SQL tuning, data validation, ETL process as well as logical, physical, and semantic data modeling

Experience working in large-scale corporate data environments resolving inconsistencies and challenges in the data

Experience working with enterprise databases such as Oracle, DB2 and Teradata

Excellent presentation and facilitation skills

Excellent oral and written communication skills

Must have ability to deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines and be comfortable manipulating and summarizing large quantities of data

Expert knowledge of the business lending lifecycle

Preferred Skills

Ability to work effectively and gain credibility and respect of key partners both inside and outside of the organization

Ability to lead and persuade others while positively influencing the outcome of team efforts

Powerful communicator who engages colleagues, business partners, external stakeholders, and employees.

Be known for providing creative thought leadership while also listening and engaging others to provide input in the shaping of that vision

Strong knowledge of the related regulatory environments

Knowledge of Chase IT tools such as ITSM and DM are a plus

JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Job

Risk

Primary Location

US-OH-Columbus-1111 Polaris / 54101

Organization

CONSUMER & COMMUNITY BANKING

Schedule

Full-time

Job Type

Standard

Shift

Day Job

Corporate Brand

JPMorgan Chase & Co.
column76:
DominoÃ¢Â€Â™s Pizza, which began in 1960 as a single store location in Ypsilanti, MI, has had a lot to celebrate lately: weÃ¢Â€Â™re a reshaped, reenergized brand of honesty, transparency and accountability Ã¢Â€Â“ not to mention, great food! In the rise to becoming a true technology leader, the brand is now consistently one of the top five companies in online transactions and 50% of our sales in the U.S. are taken through digital channels. The brand continues to Ã¢Â€Â˜deliver the dreamÃ¢Â€Â™ to local business owners, 90% of which started as delivery drivers and pizza makers in our stores. ThatÃ¢Â€Â™s just the tip of the icebergÃ¢Â€Â¦or as we might say, one Ã¢Â€ÂœsliceÃ¢Â€Â of the pie! If this sounds like a brand youÃ¢Â€Â™d like to be a part of, consider joining our team!

Internally referred to as the Analyst - Strategy and Insights (Field), this Strategy & Insights role supports the field marketing organization. The successful candidate will have strong analytic, technical and communication skills. The candidate will identify opportunities, access/analyze the associated data, and develop concise and insightful communications.
Collaborate closely with manager to prioritize initiatives and identify key issues that, when solved, will help to grow orders, sales, and profit.
Mine and synthesize across vast array of internal and external data sources to help address opportunities.
Develop strong data management skills leveraging SQL, Microstrategy, RapidMiner, and advanced Excel functionality including pivot tables.
Partner with and manage external analytic vendors when needed to address key business issues.
Develop concise communications and tools so that the field marketing organization understands and can leverage the tools to capitalize on opportunities for their DMAÃ¢Â€Â™s and franchisees.
Develop strong partnerships with internal departments such as operations and the data warehouse team.
Manage 1-2 strategic insights initiatives annually, including developing hypotheses, conducting necessary custom research and analysis, synthesizing information from diverse sources, generating actionable insights and presenting findings to WRC executives as well as the field.
Facilitate the socialization knowledge gained from all insights initiatives
Address ad-hoc business questions as needed.

BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in Market Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Predictive Modeling, Financial Analysis, Marketing or other related field, masterÃ¢Â€Â™s degree preferred
3+ years of relevant work experience (Retail, Restaurant, or QSR industry experience a plus)
Strong data management skills with experience leveraging SQL (Microstrategy and RapidMiner experience a plus)
Advanced Excel functionality including pivot tables.
Comprehensive understanding of advanced analysis techniques
Experience parterning with and managing external analytic vendors
Ability to travel up to 10%

column78:
STRATEGY AND PLANNING TEAM OVERVIEW:
The Strategy and Planning team at Ropes & Gray plays an essential role in directly supporting the firmÃ¢Â€Â™s leadership on a broad range of strategic and change management initiatives essential to Ropes & GrayÃ¢Â€Â™s practices, offices, and staff functions. The team is comprised of approximately 10 individuals who collaborate on projects and hail from a variety of backgrounds that include management consulting, finance, and law. The team leverages its depth and breadth of problem solving, market research, business analysis, and quantitative analysis skills to help the firmÃ¢Â€Â™s leaders address strategic challenges and capture new growth opportunities. In doing so, team members are afforded exciting professional development opportunities by working on a wide range of strategic projects, which may include, for example, developing a geography-based strategy for one of Ropes & GrayÃ¢Â€Â™s existing eleven offices or a potentially new office, assisting a practice by analyzing its performance along a set of complex metrics, or working with practice leaders to identify new differentiated service offerings that address evolving client needs.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
The Strategy and Planning Project Leader or Manager will be involved in leading a variety of business analyses focused on addressing the firmÃ¢Â€Â™s core strategic imperatives. The work will be project-based and will involve multi-tasking and working closely with partners and staff. The Strategy and Planning Project Leader or Manager will manage these projects through their entire cycle including scoping and initial data gathering, analysis, result interpretation, result presentation, action plan development, and operationalization. This job should be most appealing to those individuals who have a solid background in financial and business analysis and are energized by project-based work that includes multiple decision-makers and stakeholders.
Role specifics:Project leadership:
Scope out analyses, develop methodologies, assign tasks, propose priorities, manage communication with team members and customers, monitor progress to timelines, and drive work to completion

Ensure highest level of accuracy, organization, documentation, communication, and follow-through on all projects
Scoping and work planning:
Scope out projects in a methodical, concise, and clear manner

Prepare detailed work plans for projects, including schedules, resources, and dependencies

Develop detailed hypotheses and questions to be explored and outline the approach to address each one
Data gathering:
Compile and synthesize information from internal and external sources, both directly and through guidance of analysts and other staff

Understand internal data sources, data structures, and how to query them
Data analysis and modeling:
Analyze quantitative and qualitative business information and data in a structured way to find patterns and relationships

Design, build, and maintain complex Excel-based models to explore historical trends, build forecasts, and model scenarios

Guide and collaborate with other team members on designing, building, and maintaining complex Excel-based models to explore historical trends, build forecasts, and model scenarios

Develop logical methodologies to address and answer complex business hypotheses or questions through analytics
Result synthesis and decision support:
Translate analytical results into actionable findings for decision makers

Develop effective management presentation materials based on findings, including professional and flawless display of information, clear logic and storylines, using written, slide, and oral formats

Respond to follow-on requests from internal customers in a timely, professional, and collaborative manner
Relationship building:
Develop trusted advisor relationships with internal customers across practices and management

Espouse a collaborative approach to working across functions, consistent with Ropes & GrayÃ¢Â€Â™s culture of teaming and collegiality
Supervision and mentoring:
Develop more junior team members, which may not be direct reports, and support their professional growth

Mentor and teach others across the organization
General:
Demonstrate solid judgment about priorities and timing

Perform other work-related duties as assigned
REQUIREMENTS: EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, SKILLS, AND CAPABILITIES

This is a demanding position. We are looking for a unique individual to fill it. The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical skills, meticulous attention to detail, patience, poise, and presence with the ability to influence and interact with senior level management as well as junior staff. The candidate must have a demonstrated track record of successfully leading analytical projects and making an impact in a decentralized environment, preferably within a professional services firm.

MBA (or similar advanced professional degree)

Minimum 8 years of related experience, demonstrating strong analytical skills and leadership. Title and level will be dependent upon extent of relevant professional experience

Experience within law firms or the professional services industry a plus

Function productively in a decentralized environment, with track record of patiently gaining buy-in and consensus in diverse settings

Superb direct and indirect management skills

Patience with change and the a bility to conform to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines

Strong aptitude for analytical work and demonstrated strengths in problem solving and logical thinking

Work in a self-directed manner to produce accurate, flawless, well-documented work products with strict attention to detail and complete follow-up and follow through.

Work effectively in a team environment. Must be team-oriented and able to share information, goals, opportunities, successes and failures with the appropriate parties

Multi-task and effectively prioritize under time sensitive and often demanding schedules and where multiple projects are pursued concurrently

Strong written and verbal communication skills, excellent interpersonal and organizational skills

Strict attention to confidentiality

Interact effectively with all levels of personnel, including partners, senior management staff, and support staff

Proficient in utilizing technology effectively. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills are required. Experience with Business Intelligence (such as Business Objects, Elite Enterprise, and Tableau) tools is preferred

Willing to work beyond traditional business hours when necessary

Work effectively in a culturally and educationally diverse environment
APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:
Please include a cover letter with application.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Normal office environment. Incumbent is expected to work the hours necessary to fulfill the responsibilities of the position.

The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of essential functions, responsibilities or requirements.

column80:
POSITION SUMMARY:
We are currently seeking a Statistical/Database Marketing Analyst for our Database Marketing division. The Statistical Marketing Analyst contributes to the companyÃ¢Â€Â™s business strategy through the use of innovative analytic approaches and predictive models. This role is an integral part of the analytics team that influences decisions made within multiple internal groups at FULLBEAUTY Brands.

The Statistical Marketing Analyst will develop, implement and maintain statistical models using modeling techniques including (but not limited to) regression, cluster analysis, and multi-stage models. This position will apply innovative analytic approaches to optimize marketing efforts and further support business decisions in a fast-paced retail environment. This person will also conduct statistical analysis using SAS, and will leverage SQL-based relational database programming to extract data for summary and analysis.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Build predictive models and perform descriptive analytics using statistical methods such as clustering and segmentation techniques, regression, and propensity modeling to support the marketing efforts and business needs of the internal clients.

Ability to pull data using SAS, SQL, and other technologies from the analytics database and other sources.

Assess business needs and select optimal analytic/statistical technique(s) to apply for best results ranging from descriptive analyses to robust predictive models.

Create performance metrics and tracking processes to measure the effectiveness of the predictive modeling efforts. Responsible for the integrity of all models in use including reporting of model performance.

Work in a collaborative manner with team members to gather requirements, analyze data and provide workable solutions.
REQUIREMENTS:
MA/MS degree in Statistics, Data Science or related analytical field of study.

Minimum of 1-2 years of experience with hands-on consumer data research and marketing databases; serving preferably in a data-intense retail environment.

Completion of one or more programming courses like C++, Java etc required.

Capability to execute the complete modeling process from data extraction/manipulation through model development and presentation.

Familiarity with a variety of statistical models including regression, PCA, cluster analysis, propensity models, and other modeling techniques

Proven command of SAS, SQL, MS Excel/PowerPoint and ability to build predictive models. Experience with other BI tools a plus.

Ability to summarize/present analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences

Strong oral and written communication skills.

Capable of working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, handling multiple projects, meeting deadlines, able to prioritize appropriately and respond to issues quickly and creatively with an open and positive attitude.

Required Skills

Required Experience
