column164:
Who Mattersight is:

The rubber hits the road when someone picks up the phone to talk to a company. It happens over 250 million times a day. With over 60 percent of people dumping brands because of bad customer service, that phone call can make or break a business.

Enter Mattersight Ã¢Â€Â“ the only company that uses personality analysis and big data analytics to improve every customer call, increase customer satisfaction and lower costs for Fortune 500 enterprises. Our patented technology mines a private database of over 1 billion customer service calls to quickly pair customers with call center agents they will naturally, effortlessly click with. Awkward and annoying becomes satisfying and enjoyable. Frustrated becomes enthusiastic.

Mattersight helps companies make positive conversations with their customers the rule, not the exception by fostering emotional connections that turn complainers into fans.
Responsibilities & Qualifications:
Who you are:

Mattersight is seeking a leader for a newly formed Insights and Analytics team. The ideal candidate is excited about working with clients to help them leverage data and analytics to grow revenue, reduce cost, and improve customer experience.

We are looking for an individual with 6+ years of related work experience who is energized by the prospect of partnering with clients to drive value. The ideal candidate has a track record of analyzing data to find actionable insight and value that is not readily apparent. The candidate is equally comfortable with clients and spreadsheets, can synthesize and present information, coach others, and can build repeatable processes. The role will be challenging, but will reward those who thrive in a fast-paced, client-focused, and entrepreneurial environment.

What youÃ¢Â€Â™ll do:

The leader of the Insights and Analytics will leverage MattersightÃ¢Â€Â™s capability to solve customer problems and find new insights from the data within MattersightÃ¢Â€Â™s solutions. Mattersight captures millions of customer interactions and analyzes them, turning conversations into analyzable data. The successful candidate will manage a team chartered to create consistent reporting and analytical output and work with our Customer Success team to analyze data and find insights into our customersÃ¢Â€Â™ operations and the customer experience they create. The Insights and Analytics leader is responsible for, but not limited to, the following tasks: Work with Mattersight customers on specific engagements to uncover insights and unlock value from data. Work closely with MattersightÃ¢Â€Â™s Business Intelligence, Data Science, and Linguistics teams to produce analysis. Create a structured approach to finding insight and build a team that enables experience from one customer to be leveraged across many. Support MattersightÃ¢Â€Â™s Customer Success and Account teams to retain and grow accounts.
What you definitely have:
Applicants must meet ALL of the following criteria: 6+ years of work experience in consulting, business intelligence, data-driven customer experience or a related area Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical parties Ability to build relationships and influence others Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills High knowledge bandwidth and intellectual curiosity Ability to help create structure and consistency around customer deliverables Willingness to acquire skills and knowledge on oneÃ¢Â€Â™s own to meet the changing demands of the role BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree from an accredited university A passion for helping organizations create a better experience for their customers Team leadership experience
In addition to the above, ideal candidates will possess one or more of the following: Experience working with customer contact centers or other customer service functions Experience in a role with direct customer interaction Knowledge of current topics in the field of customer experience management
Other Facts:
Company Culture & Facts
Corporate Culture

Mattersight values diversity amongst its employees. Employees from all levels of experience and backgrounds are mingled together and are encouraged to learn about projects others are working on. MattersightÃ¢Â€Â™s Chicago office fosters teamwork as well as self motivation.
Eligibility & Location

Mattersight seeks candidates authorized to work in the United States. The Manager of Insights & Analytics will be based out of MattersightÃ¢Â€Â™s Chicago, IL or Austin, TX location; candidates should anticipate roughly 10-30% travel.
Compensation

Mattersight is prepared to offer a highly competitive benefits and compensation package for the ideal candidate.
Questions

Any questions regarding the position should be communicated to Patrick Stearns, Director of Talent Acquisition, patrick.stearns@mattersight.com

For more information about Mattersight, visit http://www.mattersight.com/ . Mattersight is committed to equal opportunity and affirmative action in all employment matters: Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, ancestry, marital or domestic partner status, national origin, disability or medical condition, pregnancy, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or on account of membership or affiliation with anyone in any of the foregoing categories, or any other protected category under federal, state or local law. Although particular legal provisions may differ in various locations in which we do business, our principles are the same worldwide.

This includes developing and implementing data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality. In addition, this position will be responsible for identifying reporting discrepancies by performing regular audits and initiate corrections when necessary.
Walsh is a rapidly growing, highly diversified construction company, and we constantly seek builders and business people to join our industry-leading team. Walsh employees are "built to succeed" - competitive entrepreneurs with strong character who are energized by working on a team to meet challenges and are willing to take risks after careful planning. Responsibilities:

A Bachelor's Degree with a minimum 1-3 years of work experience in database management and SQL coding
Advanced MS Excel and SQL skills
Experience using Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Business Objects and Oracle Discoverer
Ability to document and analyze data flows in a clear manner
Ability to work with various information systems and large and complex data files, transforming raw data into finished products

Entrepreneurial mentality with the ability to work in Ã¢Â€Âœwhite spaceÃ¢Â€Â to create new solutions

column166:
Students serving as Data Scientist interns work side-by-side with other data scientists using advanced hardware and software to create and develop computational algorithms and statistical methods that find patterns and relationships in large volumes of data.

Through CIA's global mission, the agency has access to unique data sets that can be analyzed in one computational environment. Successful applicants will have keen technical insight, creativity, initiative, and a curious mind.

Interns generally are required to work either a combination of one semester and one summer internship or two 90-day summer internships. Co-Op Students work on an alternating semester or quarterly basis and are expected to spend a minimum of three semesters or four quarters (this can include a summer tour) on the job prior to graduation.

Offices of the CIA - Directorate of Digital Innovation

The Directorate of Digital Innovation (DDI) is at the forefront of defining the future of digital expertise within the CIA. DDI focuses on developing the workforce with cutting-edge skills, investing in IT infrastructure, and modernizing the way the Agency does business. DDI officers help accelerate the integration of innovative methods and tools to enhance the CIA's cyber and digital capabilities on a global scale and ultimately help safeguard our nation. Learn more about the Directorate of Digital Innovation
Life at CIA:
In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, the CIA offers exciting career opportunities and a dynamic environment. We're on the forefront of world-altering events - as they happen. So working here isn't just a job, it's a mindset and a lifestyle.
Minimum Qualifications:
Pursuing Bachelor's degree in any area

GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale

Leadership abilities, initiative, creativity, integrity, technical excellence, and strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)

Ability to work independently and in a group

Experience with advanced statistical or computational programming and modern databases and distributed computing systems

Availability to work two 90-day tours prior to graduation

Attending school on a full-time basis before/following this internship
Desired Qualifications:
Interest or experience in data analytics, computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, operations research, computational social science, quantitative finance, engineering or other data analysis fields

The following items must be attached to your on-line application (PDF format preferred):

Your resume.

A cover letter in which you specify your qualifications for one or more positions.

Unofficial transcripts for all degrees.

ALL POSITIONS REQUIRE RELOCATION TO THE WASHINGTON DC METROPOLITAN AREA.

All applicants must successfully complete a thorough medical and psychological exam, a polygraph interview, and an extensive background investigation. US citizenship is required.

To be considered suitable for Agency employment, applicants must generally not have used illegal drugs within the last twelve months. The issue of illegal drug use prior to twelve months ago is carefully evaluated during the medical and security processing.
Important Notice: Friends, family, individuals, or organizations may be interested to learn that you are an applicant for or an employee of the CIA. Their interest, however, may not be benign or in your best interest. You cannot control whom they would tell. We therefore ask you to exercise discretion and good judgment in disclosing your interest in a position with the Agency. You will receive further guidance on this topic as you proceed through your CIA employment processing.
To Apply:
Save the position(s) that interest you in the job cart. You can add up to four (4) positions. Job cart selections will only be retained during this site visit, so be sure to click Ã¢Â€ÂœApply NowÃ¢Â€Â before closing the browser window. After clicking "Apply Now" you will be taken to the application account creation page. The positions will appear in the cart once you have created an account. DO NOT submit multiple applications; this will only slow the review of your application and delay processing. Please read the Application Instructions carefully before you begin the online application process.

About the Company:
PlaceIQ is a powerful, location-based audience and insights platform that organizes a wide variety of consumer activity data around a precise location base map at massive scale. PlaceIQ uses its detailed understanding of location and consumer activity to reach a targeted audience, and also to derive powerful insights about consumer behavior to inform market and business strategies for national brands. The company is headquartered in New York City and has offices in Palo Alto, Chicago, and Detroit.
The Role:
As a Data Analyst at PlaceIQ, you will define, interpret and evaluate PlaceIQ Audience products and the data that powers them. The ideal candidate will apply a unique blend of analytical and creative skills to develop hypotheses, solve problems and contribute to the growth and composition of PlaceIQÃ¢Â€Â™s suite of audience products. A Data Analyst will leverage requirements from different business inputs to analyze and deliver new audiences, as well as identify opportunities to improve existing ones.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyze different types of data geospatially to derive insights about relationships between locations, statistical measurements and qualitatively assess the data
Create audiences with ranging complexities and a variety of defining data types using our custom suite of tools
Conduct detailed audience analysis, perform database queries and reviews of test results to validate, identify issues and formulate remediation plans for improvement
Identify and align opportunities for improvement with business cases and data quality goals
Coordinate with cartography analysts to evaluate and scope data for new audience requests
Generate and communicate reports on audiences and other findings in different formats
Participate in data management and audience initiatives involving multiple customers and provide subject matter expertise
Requirements:
Experience with SQL as well as scripting languages such as Python for manipulating data preferred
Experience with location-based or geospatial data preferred
Experience with data analysis balancing the creative and the pragmatic
Experience in market research, working with consumer analytics, insights and use cases preferred
Knowledge of demographics, market segmentation and/or a background in cultural anthropology
Business solution development Ã¢Â€Â“ ability to ramp up quickly on marketing / audience domain
Highly effective written and verbal skills, experience generating and presenting content. Technical writing a bonus
Experience working in an Agile environment a bonus

Career Status: Management
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device Ã¢Â€Â“ SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
Work Experience : Minimum of 5 years SAP ABAP + SAP MDG implementation experience
Description :
SAP seeks a Master Data Governance (MDG) Business Architect is to plan and support the implementation while providing MDG architecture and design expertise pertaining to the scope and requirements of the project. Specific responsibilities will include: translation of business requirements to technical tasks, process and workflow design, system configuration, data migration, assistance with testing, technical documentation, and handover of the live solution to Support/Run teams. Business Architect will need to be able to provide configuration and development of MDG-based master data scenarios within an existing MDG system landscape.

Work Task Responsibilities
Ability to effectively explain, rationalize, and justify master data governance requirements.
Support the evolution of MDG roadmap and strategy
Develop, prepare and complete business case.
Provide guidance and advise to IT and business on best practice approaches for SAP MDG integration.
Gather business requirements from key stakeholders and translate them to a comprehensive data solution involving the effective data migration efforts required, to implement SAP MDG.
Determine the size and scope for an effective SAP MDG implementation, taking into account current data systems, the existing and planned SAP environments, identified client business requirements and objectives.
Leverage technical and functional knowledge of SAP MDG and best practice methodologies to contribute to the overall planning of projects by recommending approaches, identifying resources, and developing timelines.
Leverage knowledge of configuration and activation processes within SAP MDG, data domains, custom objects and related data model creation, data quality and SAP MDG data loading and distribution for best practices approach to SAP MDG integration and implementation.
Development, recommendation and documentation of data governance rules within SAP MDG
Work collaboratively with project managers, offshore and partner consultants to develop consulting and project methodology, techniques, tools, and solutions.
Competencies:
Expert knowledge in activation and configuration of the SAP MDG modules and components
Expertise in Data Modeling, UI Modeling, Process Modeling, and configuration of Data Replication
Expertise developing within the SAP ECC environment and SAP application landscape (ABAP)
Ability to identify, troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve Data related problems
Responsible for making solution recommendations considering project requirements
Experience working in an Agile Development environment; SCRUM methodology preferred
Strong conceptual design and analytics capabilities with an ability to balance theory and practicality
Strong problem-solving capabilities within a complex IT landscape
Experience with key mapping aspects of Master Data Governance as the central Master Data Hub
Strength in ABAP, BAPI, BADI, User Exits, ALE, IDOC, Workflow, WebDynpro ABAP, SOA web services
Knowledge in customizing the SAP Business Partner, Customer, and Supplier/Vendor Masters
Working experience integrating/deploying Fiori applications as user front-end to MDG
Expertise in integrating SAP Data Services and enterprise applications/services MDG
Expertise in MDG Master Data Consolidation and handling of Mass Data change scenarios
Exposure to SAP HANA
Education and Qualification:
Fluency in English; Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to handle one or more projects simultaneously
Ability to quickly learn new skills and be responsive to change
Undergraduate university degree, preferably in IT, Computer Sciences, and/or Business Administration
Certification in SAP MDG and/or SAP EIM solutions preferred

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: C areers@sap.com ). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

column173:
Senior Data Architect (JID 6022)

Analyst/Programmer

IT Data and Analytics

Full Time / $6249 - $8500 / mo.

NOTE: IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR ANY OF OUR POSTED VACANCIES, PLEASE COMPLETE THE CSUN ON-LINE APPLICATION PROCESS HERE: HTTP: //BIT.LY/HR_CSUN

CSUN's Commitment to You

CSUN is strongly committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, active learning and diversity. Our values include a respect for all people, building alliances with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity. CSUN actively encourages qualified candidates to apply who demonstrate a commitment to serving a diverse student population as well as a commitment to maintaining a respectful and inclusive work environment.

About the University

Serving approximately 40,000 students each year, CSUN is one of the largest universities in the United States, and it has an impact to match its size. Money Magazine recently named CSUN one of the top ten values in all of higher education, and the Social Mobility Index ranked CSUN fifth in the nation for elevating its students, economic and social well-being. CSUN ranks 10th in the country in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students, fifth nationally in awarding master's degrees to Hispanic students and enrolls the largest number of deaf and hard-of-hearing students of any U.S. state university. CSUN's 171 academic programs and engaged centers enjoy international recognition for excellence. CSUN currently partners with more than 100 institutions of higher education in 22 countries around the globe and attracts the largest international student population of any U.S. master's level institution. Situated on a 356-acre park-like setting in the heart of Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley, the campus features modern educational buildings and world-class LEED Gold-certified performing arts and recreational facilities recognized as among the best in the country. CSUN is designated as a Hispanic Serving Institution (HSI) and an Asian American, Native American, Pacific Islander Serving Institution (AANAPISI) and we value the diversity of all of our students and the campus community. CSUN is a welcoming university that champions accessibility, academic excellence and student success.

Major Duties

Under general supervision, the Senior Data Architect serves as a data modeler to enable integration of data from various data sources, including learning management system, student information system, and other institutional applications to produce reports and dashboards in support of organizational needs; serves as a liaison with user areas to understand their analytics and reporting needs; plays a key role in all aspects of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) processes; serves as a backup report writer using Tableau/OBIEE; designs, develops, troubleshoots, debugs, and implements ETL software code; translates high-level requirements into development tasks; estimates tasks based on technical debt, level of effort and complexity; works in a fast paced, team environment with multiple deadlines; and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a job-related field. Five (5) years of full-time, field-related experience, which includes 4 years hands-on ETL experience using tools such as Data Stage, Informatica or ODI, SQL writing and database programming, and experience with Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) such as Oracle, SQL Server, or similar databases.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

Extensive knowledge of: data warehousing concepts; data validation, testing and support activities. Functional knowledge of higher education data and HR data is desirable. Familiarity with Tableau, OBIEE, and academic technologies, especially with Canvas LMS, is essential. Ability and specialized skills to: code, test, and debug software applications; provide ongoing project leadership to technical development staff; analyze problems and propose effective solution; understand functional and procedural requirements and develop alternative solutions; relate system solutions to departmental management and staff; communicate effectively both orally and in writing; develop and make presentations; conduct meetings; develop and provide user training; and establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. Highly self-motivated team-player with positive "can do" attitude

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

The university offers an excellent benefits package.

The salary range for this classification is: $6249 - $10,857 per month.

The anticipated hiring range: $6249 - $8500, dependent upon qualifications and experience.

Hours: Full Time 40hrs/wk; 8:00am - 5:00pm, Monday through Friday; may include some evenings and weekends.

General Information

This position is a sensitive position as designated by the CSU.

A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.

How To Apply

Candidates should apply by completing the CSUN on-line application utilizing http://bit.ly/HR_CSUN link. NOTE: Internal candidates should apply through the portal by accessing the View Job Openings/Apply link on the Human Resources/Employee pagelet.

Applications received prior to March 9, 2017 will be considered in the initial screening and will continue until position is filled.

In order to be considered in the initial review, applications must be submitted prior to the date listed above. Application submissions received after the application screening date will be reviewed at the discretion of the University.

For more detailed information on the application and hiring process, please visit the link below:

http://www.csun.edu/careers/

Equal Employment Opportunity

California State University, Northridge is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or disability. Reasonable accommodations will be provided for applicants with disabilities who self-disclose by contacting Recruitment Services.

Job Descriptions:
We are looking for a passionate Data Analyst to turn data into information and information into insight to help drive business decisions. You will be part of the Analytics Group, which consists of other Data Analysts and Data Scientists working on challenging problems across the organization.
You will conduct full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
This position is based in our Wisconsin Rapids, Wisconsin office and provides competitive compensation and benefits.
Responsibilities
Interpret, analyze, and summarize results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Turn data into realistic, achievable recommendations and clearly communicate those to users, including executive management
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and transform data, and review existing reports, dashboards, and performance indicators to modify, enhance, and develop new reports
Provide insights into product sales, market share, and other KPIs

From: Renaissance Learning, Inc.

Knewton is on a mission to personalize learning for the world. Teachers, schools, and education companies use Knewton to power digital course materials that dynamically adapt to each studentÃ¢Â€Â™s unique needs. Knewton provides students with tailored recommendations for exactly what to study, teachers with analytics to better support each student, and publishers with content insights to develop more effective digital products.
Knewton has delivered more than 15 billion personalized recommendations to over 10 million students on every continent except Antarctica. Knewton was founded in 2008 and is headquartered in New York City with offices in London and Tokyo. We have also been recognized as a Technology Pioneer at the World Economic Forum in Davos, one of the top 100 Best Places to work by CrainÃ¢Â€Â™s New York Business and one of the Fast CompanyÃ¢Â€Â™s Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Big Data. Investments top $150M from well-known angel investors plus Accel, Bessemer, First Round Capital, Firstmark, Founders Fund, GSV and Atomico.

column177:
Data Analyst, Tempe, AZ, United States
The Data Analyst on the Analytics team is responsible for managing, analyzing and presenting accurate, actionable and data-driven insights to the business. Business leaders will work directly with and depend on you to help them see trends, identify opportunities and manage their operations. Your work will be critical to support data-informed decision making at the highest levels of our company. The successful candidate will work directly with project stakeholders, department leaders and other team members to deliver insightful analysis and critical operational reporting. You will actively influence the direction and success of Freedom with proactive analysis and recommendations based on your findings. You will be aligned with our Sales area serving both Freedom Debt Relief and Freedom Fund Asset Management divisions.
Responsibilities:
Perform deep data research and analytical work in order to provide data-driven insights and reports to our Sales area for Freedom Debt Relief and Freedom Fund Asset Management
Support business leadership with insights driven by data
Produce actionable strategic direction and help drive business prioritization that will support growth and maximize results
Effectively communicate complex analysis and insights to various stakeholders
Bring data to life through visualization and storytelling
Participate in an Agile development process for designated projects or ad-hoc requests
Help build scalable and extensible solutions for analysis projects
Appropriately escalate issues and concerns
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field
3+ years of professional experience analyzing business needs and providing valuable, data-centric insights and solutions using advanced Excel and SQL
Strong analytical, organizational and interpersonal skills
Effective communication skills required to present information to a diverse audience
Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment and execute many complex tasks simultaneously
Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work efficiently with minimal supervision
Experience developing data visualizations using tools such as Tableau
Knowledge of and curiosity to stay current on industry analytical trends
Experience analyzing financial services products and businesses preferred
Why Freedom?
As a member of the Freedom Analytics team, you will:
Work for a company that is recognized as one of the Best Places to Work
Be part of a strong entrepreneurial culture that values individuals who take ownership and deliver results
Join high-energy results-driven teammates who can also have fun!
#FFN
column178:
Qualifications

Advanced-level Excel (preferably with Visual Basic programming) and proficiency in Microsoft Access and PowerPoint
Strong independent and collaborative problem solving (and good judgment in knowing when to make independent decisions and when to collaborate)
Ability to understand and communicate the meaning of the analysis, in written and oral form, with intuitive understanding of what the analysis implies and how changes in assumptions would affect it
Ability to multi-task across a range of work streams/projects with constantly shifting priorities
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential material discreetly
Several years of relevant experience demonstrating strong quantitative skills
Experience with Alteryx, Tableau, R, or other data and visualization systems preferred though not required

Who You'll Work With

As the Partner Personnel Data Analyst, you will be a part of the Partner Personnel function of McKinsey & Company and will sit at our Atlanta, GA office.
The Partner Personnel function provides Human Resources support to our 1,800 Partners worldwide. Our Partner talent is essential to the mission of our work Ã¢Â€Â“ providing distinctive and lasting impact to our clients. The Partner Personnel function provides important support to our Partners, contributing to the satisfaction and retention of this critical group of colleagues.
The Partner Personnel function also helps Partners navigate transitions at the firm Ã¢Â€Â“ starting at the firm, choosing professional paths, going on health or parental leaves, and departing the firm. We counsel Partners, ensure all of their personnel data is accurate, and analyze the Partner population. This role will focus on analytics related to the Partner group.

What You'll Do

You will support a mix of planned and ad-hoc analytical projects to help firm leaders continue to improve their understanding of the composition and performance of the Partner group.
Specifically, you will analyze, track, and report on Partner data in areas such as departure, retention, and advancement rates; performance statistics; leadership roles; changes in professional tracks; etc. You will prepare high-impact reports and presentations for meetings with Firm, Region, and Office leaders and understand how to enter Partner information into Firm systems and work collaboratively with the team to gather and enter that information.
You will be responsible for supporting the Partner Personnel Committees through reporting, adhoc analyses, on-site analytical support at selected meetings, and post-meeting responsibilities related to reporting outcomes to firm leadership groups. Specific responsibilities could include evaluator training presentations, committee kick-off presentations, evaluation support materials, and more.
You will track historic and current leadership roles of the partner population, maintain a tracker of future leadership appointments, and provide monthly updates to senior leadership in PowerPoint. The analyst will be responsible for maintaining changes from multiple sources within the database and confirming role changes with committee, practice, and office managers.
column179:
Freedom Financial Network (FFN) has seen tremendous growth in the past few years, appearing multiple times on the Inc. 500 Fastest Growing Companies list and has been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work, many years running, in both the San Francisco Business Times and the Phoenix Business Journal. We have over 1,000 employees based in our San Mateo, CA and Phoenix, AZ offices and expect to grow to over 1,800 team members within the next 24 months.

With growth comes new opportunity!

The Optimization Analyst will be responsible for continuously improving the customer experience and improving conversion at every step of the funnel. This person is going to use site analytics to identify opportunities; develop, prioritize and schedule testing hypotheses and optimization efforts; ensure all tests/optimizations are executed accurately and according to plan, and own the reporting and communication of results of these efforts across our businesses. The person in this role should have experience managing A/B testing tools, technical expertise in test execution, knowledge of proper testing setup and hygiene, and a strong understanding of best practices in the web flow design.

Position Responsibilities:
Drive the execution of A/B tests for web form flows and landing pages for all businesses.
Quantify value estimates for all tests; prioritize these tests to optimize for strategic initiatives as well as incremental leads and revenue.
Collaborate with the creative team to create designs, partner with the technical lead to set up, QA, and launch all A/B tests.
Use technical knowledge and testing best practices to ensure optimal test setup and performance.
Regularly monitor testing dashboard for unusual results and work with teams to resolve in a timely manner.
Understand test variables and what drives short and long term fluctuations in results. Proactively cut off or extend tests based on consistent monitoring of results
Ensure all test results and recaps are completed and shared in a timely manner, and communicate strategic ideas effectively by telling the story behind data.
Work with Product Management and/or Engineering teams to implement test winners on site.
Qualifications and education Requirements:
BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in marketing or related degree, and at least 2 years prior experience in managing site optimization.
At least 2 years of experience using web analytics platforms and optimization tools like Optimizely, Adobe Target, Site Catalyst, Google Analytics etc. to perform analyses, develop hypotheses, and measure results.
At least 2 years of experience testing high volume entry pages and/or lead generation form flows, with focus on improving conversion at each step to maximize revenue.
Advanced Excel skills and ability to direct work of front-end web developers.
Deep understanding of website funnel pages and metrics; knowledge of industry best practices related to user experience, and site performance.
Well-developed project management skills, including managing multiple projects simultaneously; able to shift quickly with changes in business priorities; appropriate sense of urgency.
Why work with us at Freedom Financial Network?

If you like working in a fast paced, dynamic start-up environment, then the Freedom Financial Network is the right place for you. Although we have been in business for more than a decade, we consciously cultivate a strong entrepreneurial culture that values individuals who take ownership, provide transparency and have integrity. We believe that great companies are built on great teams (made up of great people!).

FFN values the impact that team members make on our business and the Company provides growth opportunities for those who make a big impact.

column181:
Xbox is at the forefront of the services and tech used to drive improvements across all of MicrosoftÃ¢Â€Â™s games and platforms. At Xbox, we are poised to develop incredible experiences. This role will combine skills from analytics, engineering, business, and game design to redefine how we use data to make Xbox the premier gaming experience across any device.

We want to deliver such rich, engaging scenarios that users will wonder why they ever played games on any other platform. You will be responsible for both the creation of new insights as well as a sustainable, scalable program that works with partners with rapidly evolving requirements. You will work closely with business critical partners across the entire Xbox organization including Microsoft Studios, Xbox platform and Xbox HW to ensure the right insights are delivered.

To be successful in this role, you must be able to use rigorous analytical techniques combined with expert data skills to develop highly scalable and efficient analytical models across the gaming ecosystem, sometimes going deep into a title to ensure that the best insights are available before and after launch. In addition, you will lead the creation of a cooperative learning trust across the individual studios and feature and platform teams in order to define and implement best practices for modern analytics and machine learning techniques, and how they can be applied to enable the future of Xbox gaming. The right person in this role will help shape the entertainment experience for millions of players.
Responsibilities:Work directly with Xbox teams to develop analytical best practices for measurement and design of platform features and games
Establish core measurements and methods that can be used across multiple games, game services, and hardware
Use data mining, modeling, and statistical techniques to create new, scalable solutions to enable both business and end-user scenarios
Conduct predictive data analysis oriented towards player behavior
Model player experiences using decision tree analysis and multivariate regression analysis
Deliver progression modeling, balance analysis, multiplayer performance and social impact analysis
Provide regular, timely reporting and performance monitoring to studio teams and key business stakeholders
Establish scalable, efficient, automated models for large scale data analyses
Collaborate with data modeling and visualization teams to incorporate best practices into sprint planning
Recommend new architectural designs and enhancements to existing data systems in order to optimize for high speed, low latency reporting and self-service analytics for stakeholder clients
Qualifications:5+ years of data science and/or business intelligence experience.
Passion for games, the game community and game design.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, with hands-on experience applying it to big data.
Ability to apply statistics, data mining and machine learning techniques to create new, scalable solutions for business problems.
Creation and implementation of statistical predictive models including such algorithms as decision trees, regression, clustering, association, factor analytic techniques, etc.
Advanced working knowledge of data mining using SQL, ETL and Data Warehouses. Need to be able to formulate complex SQL queries and have experience working with BI and visualization tools.
2+ years of experience with R or Python scripting (or other platform-agnostic language).
A BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s or MasterÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning or related technical field
Excellent verbal, written and collaborative communication skills in a cross-team environment with the ability to translate complex information
Added Value:PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Machine Learning or related technical field.
Experience with Azure tools and technologies (Hadoop, HDFS, Hive/Pig, Spark).
Ability to develop prototypes by compiling, manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

Position Overview

The Data Analyst role is responsible for gathering data and providing insights on usage patterns and product consumption trends within the Books business. The role works with the Books development team to extract usage data, consisting of millions of data interactions and usage records, and constructing meaningful and insightful reports and analysis on the titles that are accessed and used by the platform user base and customers. The role consolidates and reports statics on trending titles, the most popular content and constructs algorithms to project consumption patterns of content assets so that the product team can make informed decisions on products to add or to retire.

Position Responsibilities

Organizational Metrics and Reporting

Construct and maintain dashboard of key division statistics which include most popular titles, trending titles, distinct users, comparison of library vs. industry benchmarks such as Amazon, B&N and Inc. best seller lists

Analyze customer renewal and growth trends and provide associated reports

Data and Trend Analysis

Provide analysis of key usage trend as per content topic, book titles, content asset (e-books, summaries vs. audio books)

Provide recommendations to product team of titles/assets to retire or add based on utilization data

Provide detailed insight of usage patterns by publisher and imprint

Provide usage patterns by customer group and product collection

Perform analytics around key search terms and content areas the users are

searching for

Work with product marketing team to gather data from customer surveys and consolidate with other division reports

Ad-Hoc Analysis

Perform additional product, imprint and publisher analysis as assigned

Consolidate data and industry benchmarks from third-party sources and incorporate with division-level reporting

Desired Skills and Experience

3-5 yearsÃ¢Â€Â™ experience in data-intensive analysis within a metric-driven business

Proven mastery in business intelligence and analytics software such as MS Excel, MS Access, Tableau. Experience with SQL and other query languages preferred

Proven excellence in computational skills and mathematics

Proven excellence in written and verbal communication required

Highly organized and successful in managing multiple projects, setting aggressive deadline commitments and meeting them

Self-starter, team player and have the ability to lead and work with cross-functional teams

Ability to focus on detail while understanding how contributions align with the broader

product strategy

Education and Certifications

BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s Degree preferred
Equal Opportunity Employer

Organization: Accenture Analytics

Location: Northeast Region
Travel: 80-100% Required
Position: Accenture Analytics - Data Science Analyst

The digital revolution is changing everything. ItÃ¢Â€Â™s everywhere Ã¢Â€Â“ transforming how we work and play. Are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital youÃ¢Â€Â™ll create it, own it, and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise, and insight clients depend on.

Accenture Digital is powered by three practices Ã¢Â€Â“Mobility, Interactive, and Analytics. As part of our Analytics practice, youÃ¢Â€Â™ll deliver analytically-informed, issue-based solutions that help clients make faster, smarter decisions. YouÃ¢Â€Â™ll play a critical role in helping them tackle complex business issues.
JOB DESCRIPTION

Your clientÃ¢Â€Â™s eyes probably glaze over when you discuss in detail logistic regression, cluster analysis, neural nets and other segmentation models, but they certainly appreciate your uncanny ability to utilize those to lower their marketing costs and improve marketing effectiveness. Or perhaps they rely on you to provide analytics that stimulate sales, strengthen customer loyalty and generate purchases. If youÃ¢Â€Â™ve earned a reputation for your analytics expertise, Accenture may be the perfect place to take the next step in your career journey.
YOUR ROLE: Data Scientist

There will never be a typical day at Accenture Analytics, but thatÃ¢Â€Â™s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are unlimited in the ever-changing digital landscape. Here are just a few of your day-to-day responsibilities.

Ã‚Â· Design, develop and deploy state-of-the-art, data-driven predictive/descriptive models to solve business problems using the latest and most appropriate technologies in statistical modeling and machine learning.

Ã‚Â· Create new insights from predictive statistical modeling activities that target and deliver value to our clients.

Ã‚Â· Manage, architect and analyze big data in order to build data driven business insights and high impact data models to generate significant business value.

Ã‚Â· Create models and processes to collect, distill and interpret data with a view to aid better, more informed decision making.

Ã‚Â· Examine and explore data from multiple disparate sources with the goal of discovering insights which in turn can provide competitive advantage for our clients. Basic Qualifications

Ã‚Â· 2 years of experience with real data

Ã‚Â· 1 year of experience with open source machine learning tools: Python/scikit-learn or Revo R.

Ã‚Â· 1 year of experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Ruby, Perl, Bash) for orchestration and data manipulation

Ã‚Â· 1 year Data engineering experience, including SQL and experience manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis.

Ã‚Â· BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s Degree in a relevant field like statistics, computer science or applied math, physics or relevant subjects or 4+ years of experience in computer science, applied mathematics, or other quantitative/computational discipline.
Preferred Skills

Ã‚Â· Innovative and strong analytical and algorithmic problem solver

Ã‚Â· Strong background in statistical concepts and calculations

Ã‚Â· Experience with MapReduce/Hadoop and related technologies (e.g., Pig, Hive, Cascading).

Ã‚Â· Familiarity with Amazon Web Services and Elastic MapReduce a plus.

Ã‚Â· Familiarity with Hadoop based commercial packages (e.g. Cloudera, Hortonworks)

Ã‚Â· Experience in text mining/NLP
OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU

Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement

YouÃ¢Â€Â™ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects.

Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments and collaboration with experts across the company.

Access to leading-edge technology.

Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits http://careers.accenture.com/us-en/your-future/rewards-benefits/Pages/index.aspx
CALL TO ACTION
Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is hereÃ¢Â€Â”whatÃ¢Â€Â™s stopping you from pursuing it?

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

The Federal Home Loan Bank of Chicago is seeking an experienced Business or Financial Analyst to join its Mortgage Partnership Finance (MPF) Analytics Group. The group takes on a diverse role, supporting the MPF business through regular and ad hoc reporting, analytical insight, and involvement in key operational processes.
Duties:
Analyzes the volumes, quality, risk, and performance of the BankÃ¢Â€Â™s whole loan mortgage portfolio for internal management, investors, and external agencies (i.e. Office of Finance, Federal Housing Finance Agency, SEC reporting).
Supports the development and distribution of daily, monthly, and quarterly reports to monitor the BankÃ¢Â€Â™s whole loan mortgage portfolio.
Supports the use of the BankÃ¢Â€Â™s credit risk model for all Federal Home Loan Banks participating in the MPF Program, including economic factor and version testing, credit enhancement resets, retained earnings calculations, and loss position determination.
Supports the tracking and reporting of the whole loan mortgage portfolioÃ¢Â€Â™s quality control function for internal management and various investors.
Analyzes performance of loan originators and servicers. Assists in maintenance of a rating methodology and reports changes in performance against the methodology.
Develops reporting for other departments within MPF Risk Management, especially Quality Control Reporting. Leverages business intelligence tools such as Tableau for streamlined reporting initiatives.
Acts as a contact point for communication with external Bank partners and vendors.
Uses market research and develops benchmark tests to support the model validation of the credit risk model.
Assist in other new business-initiative projects as directed by the SVP MPF Risk Management, including budget projections and new product development.
Encourages teamwork, professionalism and high morale, throughout the department and the Bank.
Creates efficiencies within work tasks to eliminate or reduce manual processes.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualified candidates will possess at least 2 years of experience in a business analyst or financial analyst role (experience in financial services a plus). Experience with SQL and business intelligence tools is a plus.

BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree with an emphasis in finance, business, or economics, or equivalent work experience, is strongly preferred.
Ability to work independently, accurately, and to meet deadlines.
Strong interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with both internal/external clients and industry professionals.
Must be motivated to learn and succeed in a demanding environment that requires solutions to complex challenges.
Candidate must work well in a team environment.

Title: Online Community Manager
Department: Consumer Marketing
Reports To: Senior Marketing Communications Manager
Location: Eden Prairie, MN
FLSA: Exempt

GENERAL PURPOSE

The online community manager will act as the brand voice and advocate to support the consumer experience in online and social media channels. This role will work closely with product, content, and e-commerce teams to create and foster community interaction, handle all incoming consumer communications through online and social media channels, identify feature requests, monitor online reputation, and analyze trends. Moen's eCommerce Data Analytics and Insights Analyst will be responsible for working with the eCommerce team to mine and analyze data to understand channel dynamics and customer behavior, improve online marketing efforts, and optimize merchandising strategy for key online retailers. The position reports in to the eCommerce Data Analytics and Insights Manager and will play an important role in executing the long-term vision for the analytics and data science function within the broader organization.
Responsibilities:
Support data and analytics requests throughout the development cycle including gathering data requirements, sourcing and validating data, analyzing data, building models, synthesizing insights, and presenting results. Support analysis across multiple large-scale data sources (structured and unstructured) to identify and socialize key facts and insights from within the ecommerce channel. Uncover insights from exploratory analysis by leveraging data experiments and appropriate measurement tools. Apply multivariate statistical tools to help build predictive models, improve customer segmentation, optimize approach to online pricing, and improve elements of the digital marketing mix. Ensure data integrity and testing processes are followed for reporting and research tools. Work with internal and vendor support teams to report and resolve data discrepancies. Partner with internal and external Information Technology teams to develop short and long term data analytics infrastructure. Develop and automate daily, weekly, monthly, and seasonal reporting/scorecards to monitor the health of the eCommerce business as well as share business insights with marketing, product development, sales, and finance stakeholders. Develop, measure, analyze and report all key performance indicators for MoenÃ¢Â€Â™s online sales channels. Develop and execute performance dashboards as well as perform ad hoc and recurring analyses. Analyze performance and impact of digital marketing and merchandising investments with key etailer accounts to determine customer impact and return on investment (ROI) (for both online and in-store purchases). Proactively identify conversion breakdowns on key etailer sites by analyzing clickstream data and purchase funnel metrics; develop and test new methodologies, technologies, or approaches to find potential conversion improvement opportunities. Identify business growth opportunities via data driven insights. Develop actionable recommendations and present them to eCommerce and Business Unit leadership. Leverage internal and external data sources to gather relevant industry benchmarks for the ecommerce channel.
Qualifications:
BachelorÃ¢Â€Â™s degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics or related quantitative discipline is required. Minimum of 3 years of experience extracting, manipulating and analyzing data, drawing conclusions and making recommendations; 2 years in an ecommerce-oriented role preferred. Minimum of 2 years of experience using in-database analytics, SQL, or similar programming languages to retrieve, merge, and hygiene data from multiple sources or platforms, required. Familiarity with web analytics tools (Amazon Retail Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Coremetrics, etc.) is preferred. Familiarity with relational databases and scripting languages that support data manipulation and reporting automation; examples being SQL, Visual Basic, SPSS, R, or Python is preferred. Working knowledge of data science techniques (statistical models, various regression techniques, decision tree algorithms, cluster analysis, etc) Demonstrated intellectual curiosity with a passion for developing and analyzing large, complex data sets and converting them into the information/insights Consumer durables products experience a strong plus Willingness to travel up to approximately 10% of the time (domestically)
Competencies: Being Resilient Manages Complexity Persuades Plans and Aligns Situational Adaptability

column195:
University of La Verne

Business Intelligence / Data Analytics Analyst
Job Description Summary:
The Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analytics is responsible for assisting in various activities including data gathering, trending, modeling, forecasting, and reporting. This position will be a centerpiece between the business intelligence data warehouse capability and other functional areas of the business. The primary responsibility will be to create new dashboards and visualizations to provide insight into underlying business dynamics. The incumbent will, in concert with the database administrator, develop analytic solutions, analyze industrial-size data sets, clean and filter data, identify patterns and extracting features, and design visualizations in order to support business needs. The successful candidate for this position must be able to: (1) think analytically and logically in solving business problems; (2) know what types of data must be analyzed to find the facts needed to solve these problems; (3) have the quantitative and software skills required for conducting the analysis, interpreting the results, and helping formulate solutions.
Specific Duties:
Conceptualize, design and support the implementation of reports, dashboards, scorecards, ad hoc queries and other decision support mediums utilizing a variety of data warehouse front and back-end tools, e.g. Cognos, Operational Data Store ( ODS ), Enterprise Data Warehouse ( EDW ), and various performance related packages. The incumbent will own and deliver multiple BI projects, on an ongoing, long-term, and ad-hoc basis. In collaboration with the Senior Director of Enterprise Applications, the Database Administrator and key university stakeholders, leverage advanced functionality (parameters, reporting writing, database and meta-data configuration, APIs, complex calculations, etc.) to create, operationalize, and enhance enterprise and functionally specific reports, dashboards, and scorecards in the enterprise tools and systems. In continued partnership, analyze and translate business requirements to identify impacts, trends, and gaps. Extract, combine, and filter data sets from data warehouse(s) as well as utilizing external data sources by blending, according to internal client specifications to prepare analyses for broad and specific consumption needs. Incorporate mathematical and statistics based approach to identifying key business and customer behaviors through correlation trending and analysis. In collaboration with key university stakeholders, ensure data quality is created, maintained, and enforced. Manage ongoing reporting processes and ensure daily data extracts, refreshes and similar occur in a timely and error-free manner. Make appropriate and meaningful enhancement suggestions and drive the project to fruition.
Minimum Qualifications:
In-depth knowledge of the principles, theories, practices and techniques for managing the activities related to planning, managing and implementing business intelligence systems, reports, dashboards, scorecards, and accompanying analysis and related tools. Project management skills and experience.
3 years - Relevant IT business and work experience, including business intelligence work and related functions.
2 years - Relevant experience in data warehousing, data governance, and data integrity. Excellent, demonstrable written and verbal skills.
Preferred Qualifications:Significant (3 - 5 years) relevant: data warehouse ( ODS and EDW ) experience; Banner system knowledge and business intelligence related work in said system; Cognos experience in creating reports, dashboards, ad hoc queries, and scorecards; and SQL query experience. Solid (2 -3 years) relevant project management skills and experience.
Location: La Verne Central Campus
Special Instructions:
To be considered for this position please visit our web site and apply on line at the following link: http://laverne.edu

The University of La Verne is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employment or employees on any basis prohibited by state and federal law. University of La Verne hires and promotes individuals based on their qualifications and is consistent with applicable state and federal laws, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, disability, medical condition a or sexual orientation

column201: Dita Eyewear, an international luxury eyewear company based in Orange County, seeks to hire its first-ever Data Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for pioneering a data analytics program using a data set that Dita has collected during its more than 20 years in business. Reporting directly to DitaÃ¢Â€Â™s executive leadership team, this individual will be responsible for helping Dita increase worldwide sales, improve internal programs, streamline manufacturing and operations processes, reduce inventory obsolescence, and enhance management reporting and team efficiency. The Data Analyst will provide insights from his or her analysis to DitaÃ¢Â€Â™s various departments with the ultimate goal of helping Dita continue its rapid growth and increasing profitability. We also foresee that the Data Analyst will have an opportunity to build and manage a data analytics team as the company grows.ABOUT THE JOB: Develop and implement DitaÃ¢Â€Â™s first-ever formal data analytics program and create methodologies for analyzing the companyÃ¢Â€Â™s existing data setsMake recommendations to the companyÃ¢Â€Â™s various departments about how to collect more meaningful dataProduce complex data sets by combining various data sourcesTrack, analyze and interpret trends in data in order to make recommendations to the companyÃ¢Â€Â™s executive leadership teamUpdate and run statistical data models and other algorithms, tracking results against forecasts and fine-tuning when requiredCollaborate with cross-functional teams to support efforts to grow DitaÃ¢Â€Â™s businessImprove existing reporting and work with business units to determine reporting needsREQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: BS/BA degree or higher in a quantitative or business field (Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Economics, etc.)Minimum 3 years of relevant data analysis experienceExtensive experience with business intelligence tools (such as SQL and Tableau) and statistical analysis tools (such as R, SPSS, SAS, and STATA)Demonstrated project management skills and strong attention to detailExcellent analytical skills, strong intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervisionNICE TO HAVE: Experience with consumer products, supply chain management and/or inventory and obsolescence issuesABOUT DITA: Dita is one of the few remaining major independent eyewear companies. Founded in 1996, the brand has a cult-like following and is a must-have accessory for many celebrities, professional athletes, and fashion bloggers. The company has experienced explosive growth in recent years and is now sold by over 2,000 retail partners worldwide which include some of the worldÃ¢Â€Â™s most exclusive optical shops, fashion boutiques and department stores. We also currently have four flagship stores in some of the most desirable shopping destinations and plans to open at least ten more in the near future. Dita now has more than 120 employees in the United States, Europe, and Asia. Dita has also grown its portfolio of brands to six, with plans to add additional brands in the near future.WHY WORK FOR DITA?Dita is innovative and fast-paced company with a unique, close-knit culture. We value and promote teamwork and cross-functional collaboration. Creativity is highly encouraged and team members are given freedom to experiment within their roles.
